speak;Anil;[You seemed anxious lately, so I wanted to get you something to cheer you up.]|[The baker recognized me, so she asked me to give the amulet back to you.]
speak;Ecco;Thanks again, Anil. This is a huge load off my mind.
speak;Anil;[Well, you seem in good spirits now,]|[so I'll be taking this slice of cherry pie the baker gave me.]
speak;Ecco;You got cherry pie?! Let me have a bite!
speak;Anil;[Nah, this is all for me.]
speak;Anil;[Besides, aren't you the one who said I should indulge myself?]
speak;Anil;[Here, I'll let you have a bite if you tell me something.]
speak;Anil;[Why weren't you honest about losing your Tiger Amulet from the start?]|[You know I would've helped you look for it.]
speak;Ecco;I know, but I didn't really know if I wanted to find it again or not.
speak;Ecco;That amulet was given to me by the bishops back when I was a monk.|I'm not a devout follower of Oreg anymore,|so what was the point of keeping it around, right?
speak;Ecco;But at the same time, it reminds me of all the friends I made back at the temple,|so it's still important to me.
speak;Ecco;I don't really know what to do with it{tgm}...
speak;Anil;[Judging by your reaction when I returned it to you, I think the answer's pretty obvious.]
speak;Ecco;Yeah, you're right. I'll have to keep it somewhere safer from now on.
speak;Anil;[Good. For your honesty, here's your reward.]
speak;Ecco;Lemon tart?! You had this on you the entire time?
speak;Anil;[Yeah. The baker gave me both.]
speak;Anil;[Just thought I'd mess with you a bit.]
speak;Ecco;Whoa, TWO lemon tarts? What's the occasion?
speak;Anil;[We had some money saved up. I figured it could fit into the budget.]
speak;Ecco;Finally listening to my advice, huh?
speak;Anil;[Believe what you want to believe.]
speak;Anil;[And that's not the only thing I got for you.]
speak;Ecco;What are you looking at me like that for?
speak;Ecco;Wait a minute. Are you{tgm}...{tgm}|Oh, Oreg, are you serious?!
speak;Ecco;No, not at all! This was just really sudden.
speak;Ecco;I never expected you'd actually do this like{tgm}...{tgm} ever.
speak;Anil;[Ecco, you're the one person I can see myself spending the rest of my life with.]|[I don't want to force you into anything, but with how long we've worked together...]
speak;Ecco;Why would I? You're important to me, y'know?
speak;Anil;[Still haven't gotten a proper "yes" yet.]
speak;Ecco;Oh, just give me a second alright?
speak;Ecco;Yes. I will marry you, Anil.

name: SupportKaiTaiga
_source: speak;Kai;Yes? And you're Taiga, Ke--Ryuuji's crewmate, correct?
speak;Taiga;Yup! With intros outta the way, I got a huge favor to ask.
speak;Kai;Might take you up on it, might not. What is it?
speak;Taiga;I heard from the captain that you're a pretty smart guy.|So, I wanna see how your smarts compete against my luck in a game of blackjack!
speak;Kai;Oh? Sounds like you've got quite a winning streak under your belt already.
speak;Taiga;I've lost every game I've played.
speak;Taiga;But that just means my lucky break's gonna be HUGE!|And I have a feeling that it's coming today!
speak;Kai;You know what, I've got nothing better to do. Deal me in, Taiga.
speak;Taiga;One more time! I'm gonna win for sure!
speak;Kai;You said that the last five games.
speak;Kai;Look, maybe we can play more some other time.|And here, take your money back too. Just be glad we're working together.|I would've pocketed all of this otherwise.
speak;Taiga;But I'll definitely win next time! I swear it!
speak;Kai;I've never seen someone so horrific at gambling before.
speak;Kai;Although, this does give me an idea{tgm}...
speak;Kai;Hey, Taiga! Got a minute? I'm up for a few games of blackjack if you are.
speak;Taiga;I'm always up for a game! Let's go!
speak;Kai;Before we do, how about we make this more interesting?
speak;Kai;The loser has to do whatever the winner tells them to do.
speak;Taiga;Whoa there, those are some pretty high stakes.
speak;Kai;What are you so worried about?|I thought you said you were definitely gonna win next time. And now's next time.
speak;Taiga;Yeah, you're right! My luck's gonna turn around!
speak;Taiga;But, uh{tgm}...{tgm} Could we make it a best two out of three?
speak;Kai;And that's another bust for you.
speak;Kai;Hm, now what should I have you do? What if I{tgm}...{tgm}|Should I? No, that might be too much. But{tgm}...{tgm} Hmm{tgm}...
speak;Taiga;Oh, out with it already!|Just thinking about what you're gonna make me do is giving me chills.
speak;Kai;Alright, alright. I want you to{tgm}...
speak;Kai;Tell me everything you know about Ryuuji. No lies and don't leave anything out.
speak;Taiga;Ugh, whatever. A deal's a deal.
speak;Taiga;Anyway, Ryuuji's been captain of the Wyrmfang Pirates for three or so years now.|He wasn't always part of the crew.|We took him prisoner  years ago during our last raid on Edoyama.
speak;Kai;Speaking of that, why did you stop your raids on the capital?|It would've been a lucrative target.

speak;Taiga;Well, we gotta let our targets build up before we knock 'em down, y'know?|Otherwise, there'd be nothing left to steal.|On top of that, Ryuuji outright commanded us to stop raids on the capital|from the moment he was promoted to captain.
speak;Taiga;'Course, some of the crew didn't like that, so some of them just up and left.
speak;Taiga;He doesn't like talking about himself too much.|The only other stuff I know is that he was working under the imperial family|and just used Ryuuji as a nickname.|His real name's Kenji.
speak;Taiga;Man, all that just for some info{tgm}...
speak;Taiga;Why do you wanna know so much about him anyway?

name: SupportParkerCole
_source: speak;Parker;I know that you excel in fire magic, so I want you to practice more{tgm}...
speak;Parker;I know that you're really good, but I want you to be able to adapt.|Some magic is stronger in certain situations.
speak;Cole;Ice against fire melts, but then turns into water which puts out the fire.
speak;Cole;And the wind controls water. And the thunder can make fire.
speak;Parker;Yes, very good. I see you have been keeping up with your studies.
speak;Parker;Now, let's begin with the rest of the lesson.
# Original script by Blade of Light 12 #
speak;Cole;I have a question. What was the toughest magic duel you ever had?|I know that you're not supposed to just go into battle for the sake of it,|but I'm curious.
speak;Parker;I had to deal with a rogue dark mage that was terrorizing towns.|I ended up confronting him at a port. He wielded Nosferatu.
speak;Cole;Steals the health of its victims and gives it to the user.
speak;Cole;Definitely doesn't seem like something that would be light magic.
speak;Parker;Yes, it felt as if my very essence was being drained away.|The battle ended up being so fierce that a pub was destroyed.|The mage's tome ended up breaking so he swapped to Luna.
speak;Cole;It completely ignores the victim's will and mental endurance.
speak;Parker;In the end, I got desperate that I ended up just beating him with my fists.
speak;Cole;Sorry for asking. I'm glad you're okay.
speak;Parker;It's not your fault. You're just curious.
speak;Cole;I need to be able to lift heavier tomes for the battles up ahead.
# Original script by Blade of Light 12 #

name: SupportEccoMasashi
_source: speak;Ecco;So many cool things to buy, so little gold to spend.|What's a girl to do?
speak;Masashi;Oh, what a dazzling ray of sunshine!
speak;Ecco;What the hell?|Can't a girl think without some idiot making comments?
speak;Masashi;Most fair of maidens, you have made this already beautiful day even more|dazzling with your presence.
speak;Ecco;Look, buddy, I'm a little busy right now.|There are plenty of other women around for you to "converse" with.
speak;Masashi;Oh? What has consumed your attention so?
speak;Ecco;I'm shopping. It's how I unwind.
speak;Masashi;Shopping? As in PAYING for things?
speak;Ecco;Anyway, I'm trying to decide what to buy.
speak;Masashi;A goddess like you shouldn't have to spend money.|Tell me what you want, my lovely lady, and I'll buy it for you.|I can even help you carry your purchases.
speak;Ecco;It's so nice for a gentleman to offer to pay for me.
speak;Ecco;Now, I need this dress, that platter of pastries,|oh and that pearl necklace{tgm}...
speak;Ecco;I thought we could get some pie from the tea shop over there,|some more shoes would be nice too{tgm}...
speak;Masashi;Merin, Oreg, Medea, Fueg, Folia, please spare me!;;;thought_bubble

name: SupportMasashiHikaru
_source: speak;Masashi;Oh, Hikaru{tgm}...{tgm} Our lives surely have taken a turn, haven't they?
speak;Masashi;One moment, I led Emperor Samegoro's most powerful military unit with you by my side.
speak;Masashi;And now, we're nothing but lowly soldiers.
speak;Hikaru;I do not see what has you so distraught, milord.|You are under the command of Medeas' princess now.|I would have assumed this is nothing but a positive turn of events by your standards.
speak;Masashi;You'd think that, but that girl is{tgm}...
speak;Masashi;She's nothing like Lady Tsubaki. Let's just put it that way.
speak;Hikaru;Lady Tsubaki is quite demure. Mindful, even.
speak;Hikaru;Still, you must look at the positives, milord.|The emperor would have your head if he found out about our failure at Fort Daijima.|You said so yourself.
speak;Masashi;I suppose having our lives still intact is better than nothing.
speak;Masashi;And yet, that is the bare minimum for relief, is it not?
speak;Hikaru;As much as I loathe suggesting this, milord, would you{tgm}...{tgm}|feel better if we socialize with the local women of Medeas?
speak;Masashi;Oh, you always know how to brighten up my mood.|Let's be off, then! The beauties of Medeas await us!
speak;Masashi;I see{tgm}...{tgm} If an infantry unit were to go in this direction and wait{tgm}...
speak;Masashi;Hm{tgm}...{tgm} but wouldn't it be better if{tgm}...
speak;Hikaru;There you are, milord.|I should have guessed you would peruse the Medean Castle's library at some point.
speak;Masashi;Hikaru! Good to see you. Care to join me?
speak;Masashi;It's a textbook on various war strategies and unit formations.|I was curious about how Medean and Merinese military strategies differ.
speak;Hikaru;I see. Anything noteworthy that you've noticed?
speak;Masashi;While it is covered, there aren't many specific chapters on maritime combat.|Which is understandable, of course.
speak;Masashi;There are some rather{tgm}...{tgm} interesting tactics listed here, such as this formation.

speak;Masashi;While I do see some merit to positioning one's footsoldiers|in the forest like this, wouldn't that leave the fort wide open for an assault?|I think they would have been fine in their initial position.

speak;Hikaru;Hold on, milord. I think I see what's going on.|Notice how the calvary and pegasus knights are positioned.|They are far enough to be outside of the enemy's range of vision.|By moving the infantry to a nearby forest,|this can bring a false sense of security to the enemy.|With one's own forces out of sight,|that can lead to a successful ambush as the enemy forces approach the fort.
speak;Masashi;Aha! I see now. Good eye, Hikaru.|This is why you will always be my second-in-command.
speak;Hikaru;You flatter me too much, milord.
speak;Masashi;Oh, I also wanted your opinion on this maneuver.
speak;Hikaru;Let's see{tgm}...{tgm} Now, this one looks fascinating{tgm}...
speak;Hikaru;O Great Merin, may you bless this day and grant us protection.
speak;Hikaru;Thank you again for joining me, Lord Masashi.
speak;Masashi;No need to thank me, Hikaru. I enjoy being together with you in prayer.|It's the only time I get to see you without that permanent scowl on your face.
speak;Masashi;My dear Hikaru, you must understand that while I do jest,|it does seem you are most calm when addressing the Great Merin.
speak;Hikaru;Knowing that she watches over us does put my mind at ease.
speak;Hikaru;"For she is the anchor in the roughest storms."
speak;Masashi;Always on top of knowing the scriptures.|I never would expect less from you, Hikaru.
speak;Hikaru;Again, you flatter me too much, milord.|This is something a priest such as myself should know at minimum.
speak;Masashi;While that may be true,|I do not believe that should stop me from admiring your devotion.
speak;Hikaru;You could easily say that about any other devoted priest of Merin, milord.
speak;Masashi;And the scowl disappears once again.
speak;Masashi;Perhaps I should praise you more to keep it away?
speak;Masashi;You know, Hikaru, you're getting up there in age--
speak;Hikaru;I am barely older than you are, milord, but go on.
speak;Masashi;Haven't you considered looking for a wife?
speak;Hikaru;Quite frankly, no, milord.|My religious studies and being your second-in-command already|occupy a lot of my time.|Adding a spouse to the picture will just be too much.
speak;Masashi;But what about all those times you have been my wingman?
speak;Masashi;I'm sure at least one of those stunning beauties caught your eye at least once.
speak;Hikaru;I am not obsessed with women like you are, milord.
speak;Masashi;I will choose to ignore that remark.
speak;Masashi;However, Hikaru, please understand.|I am not saying this as your superior, but as your friend.|I don't want you to be alone and unhappy in the future.
speak;Hikaru;Milord, I promise you that I am happy with the way I'm living now.|And I won't be alone because I'll have you.
speak;Hikaru;Unless you want to hire another right-hand man anytime soon?
speak;Masashi;But what about when I find a wife of my own? It will happen someday, I'm sure.
speak;Hikaru;"A fisherman who casts will eventually reel something in," as the saying goes{tgm}...
speak;Hikaru;That aside, The Great Merin provides some company as well.|Her teachings will always provide comfort.|You need not worry about me, Lord Masashi.
speak;Hikaru;Though, part of me is glad you show so much concern for my well-being.|I am grateful to have someone like you in my life.
speak;Masashi;I can say the same to you, Hikaru. And you're right. I have nothing to worry about.
speak;Masashi;You have already found fulfillment despite your young age.
speak;Hikaru;Didn't you just say that I am "getting up there"?
speak;Masashi;You are barely older than I am, though. You've still got some youth in you.

name: SupportAnnaJake
_source: speak;Anna;Jake, there's something really important you need to know.
speak;Jake;Huh, if you're saying it like that, it's gotta be real serious.
speak;Anna;Just please promise me you won't freak out when I tell you.
speak;Jake;Aw, come on already! Just say it!|You're making me worry here.
speak;Anna;You're going to be a father.
speak;Anna;You're gonna be a father, Jake! I'm pregnant!
speak;Jake;No, no, I get that! It's just{tgm}...{tgm}|When? How??
speak;Jake;But when did this happen?|All this time, we've been too busy to do anything.
speak;Anna;Remember that one night before we got roped into this adventure?
speak;Anna;That one night when we had you in a--
speak;Jake;But, wow. Me, a father{tgm}...{tgm}|That's{tgm}...{tgm} wow.
speak;Jake;I just wish I knew about this sooner.
speak;Anna;And have you fretting over your girlfriend this entire time?|No way!
speak;Anna;And there's still not a thing to worry about now.|I've been taking care of myself just fine.|We're gonna have a family, Jake. I'll make sure of it.
speak;Jake;Right! And don't forget I'm gonna be here every step of the way too!

name: SupportAnnaXiang
_source: speak;Anna;Well, hey there, Xiang! Whatcha up to there?
speak;Xiang;Ah, hello, Anna.|I am performing a daily divination ritual.|I do this each morning to get an outlook on how the rest of the day fares.
speak;Anna;Ohhh, cool stuff! So, how does this work?|Anything special going on with these cards?

speak;Xiang;Each card in this deck has a different meaning.|The one I just drew, "The Drake", represents the concept of cycles and transitions.|It could either mean more of the same is in store for me today,|or there will be a change in routine.
speak;Xiang;I will just have to stay aware of such things.
speak;Anna;Say, have you ever thought of doing this for other people?
speak;Anna;People out there might like a forecast on how their day goes, y'know?|And you could be their go-to person to give them that foresight.
speak;Xiang;This is something I typically only do for myself.

speak;Anna;You'd be doing people a service, Xiang!|I think everyone would be happier if they knew how to tackle the day.|Plus, if we charge for it, that just means more funds for the army to work with too.
speak;Xiang;Since you put it that way, maybe I'll consider it.
speak;Anna;Oh, this is exciting. I'm gonna make flyers and everything!
speak;Anna;I'll let you know when I'm done with the prep work on my end.
speak;Xiang;Usually, the predictions don't happen this fast.
speak;Anna;Hey, Xiang! So? How's the fortune-telling business treating you?
speak;Xiang;I've had no time to myself for a week straight.
speak;Xiang;Just how many people did you advertise this to?
speak;Anna;I hung a flyer or two{tgm}...
speak;Anna;Maybe closer to a dozen in the castle town's marketplace.
speak;Anna;It's a high-traffic area, y'know? More eyes means more business.
speak;Xiang;Too much business, in my opinion.
speak;Xiang;This cannot be the only thing I do in my free time, Anna.|I have a life outside of this.
speak;Anna;Hm{tgm}...{tgm} You do have a point.
speak;Anna;Oh, here's an idea! How about I help you manage things?|I can figure out timeslots, handle the finances, all the clerical stuff!|That way, all you have to worry about is the readings.
speak;Xiang;Well, that will help a lot--
speak;Anna;Okay! Time to get some new flyers made.
speak;Xiang;Maybe I should do a quick self-reading. That's always relaxing.
speak;Xiang;"The Turtle," but it's upside-down. Emotional instability{tgm}...
speak;Xiang;*sigh* I could have figured that one out on my own.
speak;Anna;Xiang, what's going on? I thought you were completely booked today.|Where is everyone?
speak;Xiang;I canceled all my appointments for the day.
speak;Anna;You what?! But all those clients--
speak;Xiang;Can find someone else to read their fortunes.
speak;Xiang;I did some research and found others who do similar readings to mine.
speak;Anna;But why? You were really popular, Xiang!
speak;Xiang;That never mattered to me. I was only in it to help others.|I do not want to shoulder that burden on my own if I can help it.
speak;Anna;Well, I guess it is ultimately your decision.
speak;Anna;But man, we were making so much gold off of this{tgm}...
speak;Xiang;As I've said before, these readings were something I did solely for myself.|I find them therapeutic. It's something I do to self-reflect each day.
speak;Anna;Sorry for taking that away from you, Xiang. I wasn't thinking.
speak;Xiang;Now that you understand, would you like me to do a reading for you?
speak;Xiang;Though I do readings for myself,|I do not mind performing the occasional reading for a friend.|Especially if it seems like they need time to reflect on things.
speak;Anna;That's really kind of you, Xiang. Thanks.
speak;Xiang;Now, is there anything currently on your mind? Anything that's troubling you?
speak;Anna;Well, other than this business venture falling through, there is something{tgm}...
speak;Anna;How's my future with Jake looking?|I don't want to go into the details, but I just wanna know how things turn out.
speak;Xiang;I see.|For this, I'll draw three cards rather than|the typical one-card readings for my daily fortune-telling.|A topic like this needs more insight.
speak;Xiang;Allow me to shuffle the deck.
speak;Anna;Let's see, I'll pick this one, this one, and{tgm}...{tgm} that one.
speak;Xiang;Now, I'll flip each card over one by one.|The first card represents how your relationship is currently faring.|You chose "The Phoenix." It signifies passion and energy.
speak;Xiang;I don't think there's any arguing about what this is implying.

speak;Xiang;The next card represents a possible future for this relationship.|For this, you chose "The Wyrm." This one symbolizes stability and growth.|There won't be major problems on the road ahead, from what I can tell.|And the "growth" part can range from the physical to the emotional.
speak;Xiang;And finally, the final card will bridge the gap between the current state and the future.|The card you chose was "The Serpent."|This represents taking the initiative.
speak;Anna;I see{tgm}...{tgm} Yeah, I think I know what I need to do.
speak;Anna;Thanks, Xiang. Mind if we do this again sometime?|I'll be sure not to ask you too often.
speak;Xiang;I would be glad to, Anna.

name: SupportTrevorAzure
_source: speak;Trevor;Azure, I must say, you are the most beautiful man I have ever laid my eyes upon.
speak;Azure;Is this an attempt at courtship, Trevor?|If so, I applaud your boldness, but your technique needs work.
speak;Trevor;No! I mean, not that I would not consider the possibility--|Th-That is to say{tgm}...
speak;Trevor;{tgm}...{tgm} May I reattempt initiating this conversation?
speak;Trevor;Thank you. As I was trying to say{tgm}...
speak;Trevor;Your beauty has a certain feminine quality to it, and yet you're still a man.
speak;Trevor;I wish to be as confident in my own masculinity as you are.|How do you do it, Azure?{br}Please teach me your ways!
speak;Azure;Is that all? You should have just started with that.|And there's nothing to it, really. I was born a man, and that's just how I am.
speak;Trevor;I{tgm}...{tgm} I see. Thank you for your wisdom, Azure.|At any rate, that was all I wished to speak with you about.|I shall take my leave now.
speak;Azure;He didn't seem satisfied with that. But what else could I have said?|I only spoke the truth.
speak;Azure;I wonder what sort of answer he's looking for{tgm}...

name: SupportKaiTsurugi
_source: speak;Tsurugi;Let's see, we'll put this book in this pocket, then--
speak;Kai;That book looked rather interesting.|A collection of Merinese folktales, was it?
speak;Tsurugi;Yes! There's one folktale in here that's an absolute favorite of mine.|It's commonly called "The Crane's Gift". Have you heard of it?
speak;Kai;Is it the one where a farmer nurses an injured crane back to health and|the crane transforms into a beautiful woman?

speak;Tsurugi;Yup, that's it!|I know that some versions of the tale have it so that the crane gives|the farmer expensive cloth made from her feathers in exchange for his kind gesture,|but I'd say my favorite iteration is when the crane marries the farmer.|It's quite romantic.
speak;Kai;Heh, into the sappy stuff, aren't ya, Tsurugi?
speak;Tsurugi;I mean, you're not wrong, I suppose.
speak;Tsurugi;But, there's more to it than that{tgm}...
speak;Kai;Oh? What, you wanna have a crane for a wife?
speak;Tsurugi;Mister Kai, please stop twisting my words!
speak;Tsurugi;And it's not that, it's more like--
speak;Kai;Well, now you got me curious, Tsurugi.
speak;Tsurugi;Oh no no no I shouldn't have let my mouth run like that!|Why do you have this effect on me?
speak;Tsurugi;If we keep up this conversation, I might end up saying that we--
speak;Tsurugi;I have to go! Sorry, Mister Kai!!
speak;Kai;Every time I talk to this guy, the more weird he gets, I swear{tgm}...
speak;Kai;I'd go so far as to say it's his charm point.
speak;Tsurugi;Well, I'm sure you know what I want to say.
speak;Kai;Yeah. You being a crane shifter, and all that?
speak;Tsurugi;What do you mean, "and"?|Aren't you at least upset that I hid that from you?
speak;Kai;Not particularly.|It's understandable why you wouldn't want that fact out in the open.
speak;Kai;If anything, it makes me curious about something.
speak;Tsurugi;No offense, Mister Kai, but you're always curious about something.

speak;Kai;But as I was saying, I started thinking about that one folktale. "The Crane's Gift".|Now, correct me if I'm wrong, but I assume you like it so much because|you experienced something similar to the story, didn't you?
speak;Tsurugi;Right you are, Mister Kai. That's exactly it.
speak;Kai;So close to living out an actual fairy tale, aren't you, Tsurugi?
speak;Tsurugi;Oh come on, don't tease me like that{tgm}...
speak;Kai;Sorry, sorry.|But seriously, I gotta ask: who was the "farmer" who helped you?
speak;Tsurugi;It{tgm}...{tgm} It was you, Mister Kai.
speak;Tsurugi;It was a few years ago, but considering what form I was in,|I wouldn't be surprised if you didn't realize it was me.
speak;Kai;You know, now that you mention it,|I do remember there being a crane with|a broken wing resting in the castle garden by the pond{tgm}...
speak;Kai;You're saying that was you this entire time?
speak;Tsurugi;Yes. I wanted to repay you back then, but I had to hurry back home before I could.
speak;Tsurugi;And now, I finally get to see you again.|You're still as kind as I remember, Mister Kai.
speak;Kai;Heh, seems like every part of my past is catching up to me. Even this.
speak;Kai;I guess this is what I get for running away from it.
speak;Kai;Hey, I'm not saying I hated everything about my past.|I'm glad I could help you back then, Tsurugi. You seem well off now.|It's good to see you again. Really.
speak;Tsurugi;I'm only here now because of you.

name: SupportTrevorAzureA
_source: speak;Trevor;My parents believed I took on this identity to avoid the responsibilities|of being the Valoria family heir.|But they were wrong! Being a man is more comfortable for me. That's all.|I only wish that they understood that.
speak;Trevor;And so, I began this new life for myself.|Living as the man I wanted to be.
speak;Azure;So that's why you asked me about being masculine.
speak;Azure;If it's any consolation, I would never imagine you as a woman, Trevor.
speak;Azure;When you had asked me about being a man,|I thought perhaps you lacked some self-confidence.|I would have never imagined not being born as one|would be the reason for your question.

speak;Trevor;Perhaps self-confidence is a factor in this as well.|However, being seen as a man does bring me great joy.|I want to hold onto this happiness for as long as I can.|If I keep going like this, then I'm sure the others will believe|I am a man through and through.
speak;Azure;I'm sure they already do, Trevor.
speak;Trevor;You have been a great friend.
speak;Azure;Of course, Trevor. I'm glad I could be there for you.

name: SupportKristaChell
_source: speak;KristaShirtless;Hey, Chell!|I wasn't expecting to meet my favorite pegasus knight here.
speak;ChellShirtless;Heh. You say that to every knight in your service, but thank you.|I like to relax in the sauna after a good training session.
speak;KristaShirtless;Same here.|Your shoulders look great! I didn't realize how good they were.
speak;ChellShirtless;On that note, your back is looking good.|How is your swordsmanship with Kai going?
speak;KristaShirtless;Going good! He's very quick with a blade.|Speaking of which, how's your axe training going?

speak;ChellShirtless;It's going well. It must be where the shoulder muscles are coming from.|Anyway, if you ever want to train together, I'm at your service.|I'm sure we could learn a lot from each other.
speak;KristaShirtless;Sure! I'd like that.|Besides, I can see your thunder thighs in action.
speak;ChellShirtless;Your thighs are pretty good as well, Your Highness. I'll see you next time.
speak;Krista;Off to the sauna again, Chell?
speak;Chell;Why, yes. Would you like to join me?
speak;KristaShirtless;Man, I didn't think it'd be possible,|but I think you got even buffer since the last time we were in the sauna together.
speak;ChellShirtless;Hm? I might be. I have been incorporating more meat into my diet.|And with all the extra training and practice spars, it's not too surprising.
speak;ChellShirtless;On that note, you've been getting more muscle definition as well.|Your back muscles especially.
speak;KristaShirtless;Really?|I can't get a good look at them myself, so I'll take your word for it.
speak;ChellShirtless;Speaking of training, still going well, I take it?
speak;ChellShirtless;You know, despite you switching teachers multiple times,|I can still see my father's influence on your technique.

speak;ChellShirtless;Your defensive maneuvers are similar to Forrest's.|And you've gotten more swift with the blade after Kai started to teach you.|However, the power you put into your swings was something my father|advised to you, wasn't it?
speak;KristaShirtless;Sure was.|Ol' man Gibson always did say the best defense is a good offense.
speak;ChellShirtless;Yes, that sounds like something Father would say.
speak;KristaShirtless;Gibson was a good man.|I still miss him, but it must be a lot tougher for you.
speak;ChellShirtless;That is true. I miss him dearly.|But I cannot let that weigh down on me.
speak;ChellShirtless;Father, why? Why did you have to die like that? You were so strong.
speak;ChellShirtless;Sam tried to avenge you and he got some of them, but{tgm}...
speak;ChellShirtless;I will get stronger, Father. I will be strong enough to crush their skulls with my thighs.|I will stamp them into dust.
speak;ChellShirtless;HYA! HRA! HOO-AH! I WILL KILL THEM ALL!
speak;Krista;Chell? Was that you just now?
speak;ChellShirtless;Oh, it's you, Your Highness. Pardon me. Let me get my shirt on.
speak;Krista;There's no need. It's just us, and none of the men are around.|What are you doing training so late?
speak;Krista;And all that yelling earlier{tgm}...{tgm} I caught some of it, but...
speak;ChellShirtless;I had a dream about that day.

speak;ChellShirtless;Sometimes when I'm too angry or awake to sleep, I come here and train.|Really train. Holding nothing back.|But I get really sweaty and build up quite the heat,|so I only do training like this at night.
speak;Krista;You want those bandits killed, don't you?
speak;Krista;It's not about justice. You want them dead and rotting somewhere, right?
speak;ChellShirtless;I'm sad to say, but it's true.
speak;Krista;So, you getting as strong as you have, there's a drive behind it.
speak;Krista;What I should do is reprimand you.|Tell you vengeance isn't the answer, blah, blah, blah.
speak;Krista;Because I understand.|How sometimes anger boils up inside you and you gotta let it out somehow.
speak;Krista;It's hard to keep that sort of thing down. Especially when it's that intense.
speak;Krista;All I ask is that you rethink your reasons for going after them.|Getting rid of evil-doers is good on paper,|but you gotta think about the motivation behind the act, too.
speak;Krista;I just{tgm}...{tgm} don't want to let you lose yourself to your anger, Chell.|You might end up doing something you regret.
speak;Krista;You don't have to come to any conclusions right away.|But when you feel like you're ready,|I'll be there to back you up no matter what you end up deciding to do.
speak;ChellShirtless;Your Highness{tgm}...{tgm} Thank you.|I'll keep honing my strength until then.
speak;ChellShirtless;One day, I will bring peace to my parents with no regrets.
# A Support Original script by Berserker Sam #

name: SupportTrevorSam
_source: speak;Trevor;Ah Sam, my lusty axe fighter! How did you come into possession of a Wind tome?|And what were you doing with it exactly?|You seem to have no magical potential to speak of.
speak;Sam;I took it from a bandit's corpse.
speak;Trevor;Ah yes, of course.|But why keep it at your cabin? Why not sell it?
speak;Sam;I found that if I kept it open, it kept the cabin cool during the summer.|Quite the breeze too.
speak;Trevor;I beg your pardon? You kept it to cool off your house?
speak;Sam;Sure did. The old place gets hot in the summer.
speak;Sam;Oh, there was a Fire tome too.
speak;Trevor;Please don't say you used that to keep the cabin warm in the winter.
speak;Sam;Nope, I used it to cook with!
speak;Trevor;What?? What did you do?|Tear it up and use its pages as ignition fuel?
speak;Sam;No man, that's crazy. Only someone inept at starting a campfire does that.
speak;Sam;I found that if I struck a piece of wood across the book,|it would catch on fire and then the rest is easy.
speak;Trevor;Thank you, my boisterous friend.|This conversation has been enlightening, but I need to take a reprieve.
speak;Sam;How can someone talk so much but say so little?|And why was he so upset at such simple practical uses of something|otherwise useless?
speak;Trevor;Was I assuming things wrong? 'Cause if that was what was goin' on, then{tgm}...{tgm} Hm{tgm}...
speak;Sam;Trevor! Figures that you'd be here with your nose in a book.
speak;Trevor;S-Sam?! You startled me. What're--|I mean, what may you be doing in the castle library?
speak;Sam;Wanted to find something for a light read. What are you up to?
speak;Trevor;Reviewing the fundamentals of magic.|Quite frankly, our conversation the other day has vexed me for some time now.
speak;Sam;Got a problem with how I used those tomes?
speak;Trevor;Though your activation methods were{tgm}...{tgm} unconventional,|the tomes you acquired were able to perform their intended functions.|Yet, you have no magical potential to speak of.
speak;Trevor;Magical tomes act as amplifiers to a user's magic potential.|If there is no potential, then they simply won't work.
speak;Trevor;You cannot create something out of nothing, Sam. That is just simple logic at work.|With that in mind, I realized the answer I sought was in front of me all along!
speak;Sam;I don't like where this is going{tgm}...
speak;Trevor;Sam, my dear friend, you actually DO have magical potential within yourself!|That is why I would like to propose--
speak;Sam;Nope. Nuh-uh. I'm not hearing it.
speak;Sam;Trevor, I ain't gonna start using some stupid spells just because you|figured out that I could.
speak;Trevor;That is not what I was about to say at all!|You are much too proficient with the axe to even consider quitting that.
speak;Sam;Huh. Color me surprised. Then, what were you gonna say?
speak;Trevor;I would like to closely observe you using your tomes.|You may be doing something that even the most learned scholars have not thought of.
speak;Sam;You're just gonna observe? No weird experiments or anything?
speak;Sam;Alright, Trevor, you can watch me use them.|I'll let you know when I've got some free time.

name: SupportSamJoshua
_source: speak;Sam;Thanks, man. Yours is awesome too.
speak;Sam;Nice sword. Do you always carry that massive thing around?
speak;Joshua;Folks kept asking me to shave until I started carrying Old Iron around.|What about you? Do you always carry that axe around?
speak;Sam;People would start asking me to shave if I didn't.
speak;Sam;Sure! What are we training today?
speak;Joshua;Arms. Every day is arm day.

name: SupportSamMasashi
_source: speak;Masashi;Sam, you are a fellow appreciator of the female form, correct?
speak;Sam;Are you asking if I like girls? Don't all guys do?
speak;Sam;Anyway, I don't like where this is going{tgm}...
speak;Masashi;Let's go into town, find a nice restaurant, and woo some lovely maidens.
speak;Masashi;First, though, you need to get a shirt on.
speak;Masashi;But the staff won't let you in otherwise!
speak;Sam;Then find a place that's less picky.
speak;Masashi;So now that we're here, you can see there are several lovely-looking ladies.
speak;Masashi;But don't be hasty in your pursuit.
speak;Masashi;You must observe the maiden. Watch her mannerisms.
speak;Masashi;Ensure she has grace, charm, and is a proper, cultured lady.
speak;Sam;We've only met. We're hardly friends yet.
speak;Masashi;Now, to answer to your baseborn question,|you don't want to get with some mannerless oaf who|can't tell which fork to use at the table!
speak;Masashi;She must have some refinement, manners, grace of movement. A *lady*!
speak;BuffBarmaid;Pardon me, gents! Would either of you like a refill?
speak;BuffBarmaid;Not a problem at all, good sir!
speak;Masashi;And THAT is exactly what I'm talking about. How crude!
speak;Masashi;Such a cur, that one. I'd look elsewhere.
speak;Sam;Yeah, but did you see how thick her legs were? And those shoulders!|She could carry a beer barrel with one arm!
speak;Sam;She's buff, Masashi. Did I stutter?
speak;Masashi;By Merin, what kind of a wingman is this man? He has no taste!;;;thought_bubble
speak;Sam;Oh, she's swinging by again! One sec.
speak;BuffBarmaid;In two hours I will be, handsome.
speak;Masashi;Dear Merin, what am I to do?

name: SupportSamTaylor
_source: speak;Sam;Huah! Rargh! Hoorah! You're dead now!
speak;Taylor;Huh, his axe maneuvers are better than I would've expected for|one living in the wilds for so long.
speak;Sam;Ah, Taylor! Didn't notice you there. You here to train too?
speak;Taylor;I was, yeah. Your attacks are surprisingly accurate. Fast too.
speak;Sam;I had a few good trainers.
speak;Sam;He was one of them.|Though, I encountered a few mercenaries who taught me a few things too.
speak;Taylor;So, what do you do when you're not training?
speak;Sam;Uhh{tgm}...{tgm} Stare at Chell's thighs and ass?
speak;Sam;Uhh{tgm}...{tgm} Stare at Krista's thighs and ass?
speak;Sam;Wait, I said that out loud?
speak;Taylor;You know what, why don't we continue this conversation in a more relaxing atmosphere?
speak;Taylor;Tavern here we come! Have your drinks ready!
speak;Sam;Oh no! I don't think this is a good idea!

name: SupportSamCeleste
_source: speak;Celeste;Hoo-ya! Take that, meanie!|Now, stay down, stupid bandit! Ya!
speak;Sam;Hey, kid! Training your axe skills again?
speak;Celeste;Hey, mister! Yeah, I gotta get stronger!|Need to do my best and to keep my friends safe.
speak;Celeste;Who wants a boring old sword anyway?
speak;Celeste;I can chop wood with this if I need to!|When was the last time a swordfighter chopped up wood with a sword?
speak;Sam;They're also fun to swing through the air.
speak;Celeste;I tried to get Michael to use an axe, but he just sticks to his lance.
speak;Celeste;I tried to get my friend Michael to use an axe, but he just sticks to his lance.
speak;Celeste;I never really got the appeal.
speak;Sam;The spear is a good weapon, though.|I don't use one myself, but yes, axes are great.
speak;Sam;What got you to use axes in the first place?
speak;Celeste;My mom. This was her axe.
speak;Celeste;She was the one who taught me and Michael how to use our respective weapons.
speak;Celeste;She's the one who taught me how to use an axe in the first place.
speak;Celeste;Yeah. That's why I'm going to be the best axe swinger around one day!|They'll sing songs about Celeste the Invincible!
speak;Sam;I look forward to it. Keep improving, kiddo!
speak;Celeste;Okay, you bandit, now where were we?

name: SupportKaiYumi
_source: speak;Kai;It's impolite to stare, you know.
speak;Yumi;My, aren't you sharp? It makes me wonder if you're used to getting stared at.
speak;Yumi;Does the nickname "The Escort Mercenary" mean anything to you?
speak;Kai;Can't say it does. Should it?
speak;Yumi;I've heard that a handsome young mercenary from Merinas|has been selling more than just his sword arm.
speak;Kai;Well, I can admit my "swordplay" is decent.
speak;Kai;And I have shown it off to those willing to pay me.|Though, I'd imagine not as often as these rumors say.
speak;Yumi;So, you're saying it HAS happened.
speak;Kai;Since you seem so interested in my services, let me lay out my terms.
speak;Kai;Payment consists of both gold and information.|If the info's not good enough, it's a no-go.
speak;Yumi;Oh, it's good. Trust me. Working for the arena's got its perks.
speak;Kai;In that case, how about we talk business over some drinks?|Let's see how good that info of yours really is.
speak;Yumi;Kai, do you mind if I ask you something?
speak;Yumi;Wha--Hey! You can't just run off like that!
speak;Kai;Good job tailing me, but I'm still not gonna talk about that.

speak;Kai;You gave me your payment and I delivered. Transaction's over.|I make it a policy to not dwell on nights like that after the fact.|It's best if you did the same, Yumi. I wouldn't want you to get attached.
speak;Yumi;Get attached? Just what kind of girl do you take me for?!
speak;Kai;I've seen this sort of thing happen before, Yumi.
speak;Kai;We start talking more, you pay for more one-on-one time,|one thing leads to another--
speak;Yumi;Don't be so full of yourself! You weren't even that great.
speak;Yumi;Oh, good. You're actually listening to me.
speak;Yumi;It was such a drag! Where was the energy? The passion?
speak;Yumi;Honestly, I feel bad for anyone who paid for such a poor display.
speak;Kai;Well, my past clients were satisfied enough, so why should I care?
speak;Yumi;Do you even hear yourself right now?!|What about any future clients? You need to step it up for their sake.|Be glad I'm not asking for a refund.
speak;Kai;Wow, harsh words, Yumi. Harsh words.
speak;Kai;But, again, the transaction's done. End of discussion.
speak;Yumi;Oh no, it's not. I am getting my money's worth out of you whether you like it or not.
speak;Kai;Oh, dear Merin, you're not suggesting...
speak;Yumi;My quarters. I'll let you know when I'm free.
speak;Yumi;I'm sure Her Highness would LOVE to know|what her loyal retainer has been doing in his free time.
speak;Yumi;That wasn't any better than last time.
speak;Kai;And I keep telling you I don't care.
speak;Kai;Whatever you're looking for, you're not gonna find it with me, Yumi.
speak;Yumi;Why bother with this line of work then?
speak;Kai;Because there's a demand. It's all a means to an end.
speak;Yumi;Come on, you can't honestly believe that.|Hasn't there been at least one client who you maybe{tgm}...
speak;Yumi;Wanted as more than just a client?
speak;Kai;Nope. It's just a job to me.
speak;Yumi;Do you just not like doing it?
speak;Kai;I didn't say that. I just don't feel one way or another about it, is all.
speak;Kai;I know most people say they actually get excitement out of it, but not me.
speak;Kai;Like I said before, as long as we both get what we want out of it,|I don't care how they feel.|At the end of the day, it's a transaction.
speak;Yumi;You know, if you said all that to begin with, I wouldn't have pestered you about it.
speak;Kai;It's what I was trying to say from the start.
speak;Yumi;Sorry for wasting your time, Kai.
speak;Kai;I'll refund you the gold, Yumi.|You said you'd want your money's worth, and you're not gonna get it.|So, it'd be in your best interest to take it back.
speak;Yumi;Think of it as compensation for me being a bother.
speak;Kai;Anyway, I'd better get dressed and out the door.|Better to slip out while it's still dark, after all.
speak;Kai;Hey. Before I go, I just wanna say thanks.

name: SupportTrevorXiang
_source: speak;Trevor;Ah, Miss Xiang! May I have a moment of your time?
speak;Trevor;You seem quite adept at using dark magic--
speak;Trevor;Now this is exactly why I am in need of your assistance!
speak;Trevor;You see, I wish to delve deeper into understanding the inner workings|of various types of magic.|Under normal circumstances, I would ask Felicity to help in this endeavor.
speak;Trevor;However, she seems more interested in being an overall nuisance|rather than a fellow arcane scholar.
speak;Trevor;Miss Xiang, could you please teach me everything you know about da--|I mean, elder magic?
speak;Trevor;In return, I could teach you anything you may desire about anima magic.
speak;Trevor;It seems I have much to learn!

name: SupportForrestKai
_source: speak;Kai;Sure was. Let's see, that puts our monthly spars at a tie again with four wins each.
speak;Forrest;Seems so. Though we're evenly matched, your speed always impresses me.|It feels as if you can get another attack in before I can do anything.
speak;Kai;Thanks, but it's not like you make it any easier for me.|Your defensive maneuvers always keep me on my toes.
speak;Forrest;Perhaps one day we'll see who's the better one between us.
speak;Kai;I believe we already established that around eight months ago.
speak;Forrest;That was a fluke and you know it.
speak;Kai;Aw, don't be like that. Look at it this way.|If I didn't win, you would've lost out on the best sparring partner in the world.
speak;Kai;Come on. You like having me around. Admit it.
speak;Forrest;Before this conversation, I would have agreed.
speak;Forrest;But I suppose training alongside you has had its benefits.
speak;Forrest;If I knew you were this insufferable, I would have never agreed to hiring you.
speak;Forrest;Still, your knowledge has proved useful time and time again.|You have been a great addition to our ranks thus far.
speak;Forrest;At any rate, I will be preparing for our next spar.
speak;Forrest;Don't expect me to go easy on you.
speak;Kai;I never do, Forrest. I never do.
speak;Kai;Hey, I've been wondering something.|What reasons do you have for training as much as you do?|Aside from the obvious, of course.
speak;Forrest;I'm afraid the obvious reason is my only reason, Kai.|Protecting Her Highness is my duty, and I take this duty seriously.|I'd even lay down my life if it meant ensuring her safety.
speak;Kai;You sure have a one-track mind.|Is that why you were so dead-set on beating me during our first spar?

speak;Kai;It checks out if that were the case. We did agree that if I won, I'd be hired, after all.|Were you so opposed to have anyone get close to Her Highness|that you'd do whatever it took to keep her out of reach?
speak;Kai;With how much you wear your heart on your sleeve,|I'm surprised Her Highness hasn't figured out that you--
speak;Forrest;We are ending the conversation here!
speak;Forrest;Have I mentioned how insufferable you can be?
speak;Kai;In all seriousness, your devotion is almost enviable, Forrest.|Can't say I'm of the same mentality, though.|I value my own existence much more than anyone else's.
speak;Kai;If I realized that sooner, then maybe things could've been different{tgm}...
speak;Forrest;What do you mean by that?
speak;Kai;Ah, it's nothing. Just me thinking aloud.
speak;Kai;Anyway, good spar again, Forrest.|Keep up the good work.
speak;Kai;Forrest, I've been wondering this for a while now,|but about Prince Ervan{tgm}...
speak;Forrest;I don't like where this is going.
speak;Kai;I haven't even said anything yet.
speak;Kai;How did you feel about him?|Considering how protective you are of Her Highness, assumptions can be made.
speak;Forrest;We're due for our monthly spar, you know.|Perhaps I'll give you an answer if you best me.
speak;Forrest;Draw your sword, Kai. We're due for our monthly spar.
speak;Kai;Who's being the insufferable one now?
speak;Kai;I win, you spill. You win, you keep your mouth shut?
speak;Kai;I'll definitely win, then. I'll make sure of it.
speak;Kai;You're lucky I like you.|I never would've followed through on this otherwise.
speak;Kai;Seriously, Forrest, that was the hardest I've ever seen you fight.|You don't even get like that in an actual battle.
speak;Forrest;I apologize. I don't know what came over me.
speak;Forrest;If you absolutely must know, I harbored no ill feelings towards His Highness.
speak;Forrest;That does not mean I would consider laying a hand on him.|Nor would I find joy in any misfortune befalling him.
speak;Forrest;When Her Highness informed me of what happened,|I was more shocked than anything.
speak;Forrest;I can't even begin to think what went wrong that day.
speak;Kai;You had absolutely nothing to do with it after all.
speak;Forrest;I suppose that would be the logical thing to do.
speak;Forrest;With all this in mind, Kai, what will you do now?
speak;Kai;I'll keep doing what I've been doing.
speak;Kai;Regrettably, there's still questions that need answers.|I'll be sticking around until I find them.
speak;Kai;With how far things have gotten, it's all I really can do.
speak;Forrest;It's just{tgm}...{tgm} I felt envious of him. That's all.
speak;Kai;Why be so defensive about it, though?
speak;Forrest;Knowing you, you'd accuse me of arranging the prince's death.
speak;Kai;Just for that? Forrest, you think so low of me.
speak;Kai;I suspected you from the start.
speak;Kai;Granted, I've been suspicious of both you and Her Highness.|But now, let's just say you're off my list of possible suspects.
speak;Kai;What's with that face? I figured you'd be happy about that.
speak;Kai;Admittedly, there have been rumors going around.
speak;Kai;I can't exactly discount them. Not when they could be a feasible lead.
speak;Kai;You're always so on edge when it comes to her.|I wouldn't worry about it, especially if she's innocent.
speak;Kai;Do you doubt her, Forrest?|Or is there something else weighing down on you?
speak;Forrest;I've held up my end of the bargain, Kai.|I do not need to indulge your curiosity any longer.
speak;Kai;Forrest{tgm}...{tgm} Just what do you know?
speak;Forrest;Is that all you wish to say?
speak;Kai;It's just{tgm}...{tgm} if you weren't there, things would have been a lot worse. So, thanks.
speak;Forrest;I have no need for your gratitude.
speak;Kai;I know. I still wanted to say something.
speak;Kai;I still think your feelings about Her Highness are completely self-destructive.|However, if you didn't act when you did, we may have lost her.
speak;Kai;And if we did, it would have been my fault.
speak;Kai;I thought about what you said back then. That guilt would have been too much to bear.
speak;Kai;Perhaps I was wrong when I left Lady Tsubaki too.
speak;Forrest;No, I believe you had every right to call me out. All I've known is protecting Her Highness.|This duty clouded my mind to the point where I forgot I had my own life to live.
speak;Forrest;When I rescued Princess Krista from Circ's Talons, luck was on my side.
speak;Forrest;If I hesitated for even a moment{tgm}...
speak;Kai;But you didn't. And that's what matters.
speak;Kai;When you factor Princess Krista out, it's quite admirable.
speak;Kai;It's for that reason, I've come to{tgm}...
speak;Kai;And that's where we're ending things off. See ya.
speak;Forrest;Ha{tgm}...{tgm} Even when you confess your love, you still keep your heart guarded.|That's just how you are, isn't it?
speak;Forrest;Kai, there is nothing to be ashamed about.
speak;Kai;I said all those horrible things to you, though.|Why would you even care about my feelings?
speak;Forrest;Let me put it this way.|When I went after Princess Krista, her safety was my top priority.|But beyond that, my mind went to you.
speak;Forrest;When you stayed behind, I felt betrayed. My heart felt so heavy.
speak;Forrest;I{tgm}...{tgm} never thought I could feel this way about another man.
speak;Kai;How do you feel about me, Forrest?
speak;Forrest;I think{tgm}...{tgm} I'm in love with you too?
speak;Forrest;It's so much to think about{tgm}...{tgm}|I don't know what to do with myself.
speak;Kai;We'll figure it out together, then.

speak;Kai;If you're struggling, I'll be there for you.|You're my friend, my sparring partner{tgm}...{tgm}|And honestly, I wouldn't mind if you were more than either of those things.|If you'll have me, I could be the same for you.
speak;Forrest;I{tgm}...{tgm} Yes. I would like that, Kai. Very much.
speak;Kai;I know I'm not great with commitment,|but I think some of your devotion is starting to rub off on me.
speak;Kai;I'll stick with you 'til the end no matter where it takes me.|That's a promise.
speak;Forrest;Kai{tgm}...{tgm} Thank you.|That means more to me than you can ever know.

name: SupportForrestMarina
_source: speak;Forrest;♫ Hm-hmm hmmmm~ Lala la doo doo{tgm}... ♫
speak;Marina;Oh, Sir Forrest. Was that you just now?
speak;Forrest;Miss Marina! You startled me.|And I'm sorry, but what are you referring to?
speak;Forrest;My singing? I'm not being a nuisance, am I?
speak;Marina;The complete opposite, actually! You have quite the voice, Sir Forrest.|If you weren't a knight, I'm sure you would make an excellent bard.
speak;Forrest;I{tgm}...{tgm} Thank you?|I'm not sure how to take that.
speak;Marina;Take it as a compliment, dear.
speak;Marina;Trust me, if this knight business goes south, you have nothing to worry about.|You have your charming voice to fall back on.
speak;Marina;Though, even if you didn't have the gift of song,|your handsome face could get you far in other lines of work{tgm}...
speak;Marina;Pay no mind to that last thing. It was merely a joke.|I'll let you get back to your chores.
speak;Forrest;Just what did she mean by other lines of{tgm}...?
speak;Forrest;D-Did she really mean{tgm}...?!{tgm}|No, of course not. Why would she insinuate{tgm}...
speak;Forrest;For the love of Medea, I spend too much time with Krista{tgm}...
speak;Marina;♫ Bryl mysteque yitrouc di rossbel eu felk~ ♫
speak;Marina;Haha! I see it's your turn to walk in on me this time.
speak;Forrest;I apologize. I did not mean to disturb you.
speak;Marina;Oh, Sir Forrest, you can be so serious sometimes.
speak;Marina;Why don't you stay here and relax for a little while?|You must be busy, but a few minutes of rest won't hurt, I'm sure.
speak;Forrest;It would be rude if I declined, wouldn't it?|I shall take you up on your offer, then.
speak;Forrest;May I ask you something first, Miss Marina?
speak;Forrest;What was that song you were singing just now?|It was quite beautiful.
speak;Marina;Ah, it's a folk song that originated from Lake Lunaris.|It's called "Moon Forest".
speak;Marina;Indeed.|Its lyrics speak of the moon's beauty as it's reflected upon Lake Lunaris's surface.|I could teach it to you, if you'd like.
speak;Marina;Absolutely. I wasn't lying the other day when I said you had a good voice.|Honestly, I just want to hear you at least attempt to sing it.
speak;Forrest;I'll do my best, Miss Marina.

name: SupportForrestAlex
_source: speak;Alex;Hm{tgm}...{tgm} Perhaps if I hold it like this? Then do this?
speak;Alex;No, that doesn't seem right either{tgm}...
speak;Alex;I'm sorry for putting you through this, Tia.
speak;Alex;Once we get it done, I'll let you have an extra helping of oats.
speak;Alex;Ah, General Forrest! Perfect timing.|Do you have a moment?
speak;Forrest;I do. Did you need something?

speak;Alex;Yes. You see, back when your father led the royal army,|he taught the lance cavalry unit a certain technique.|I was just barely a squire back then, but I wanted to learn it myself when the time came.

speak;Alex;I have been looking over this combat manual he wrote,|but I'm not sure if I'm performing the actions detailed in it correctly.|Do you mind looking it over while you observe my and Tia's movements?|I could really use an outside perspective.

speak;Forrest;You have the right idea, but there's still room for improvement.|Point the tip of your lance a little lower from where you intend to strike.|That will give you a better view of your target and|it will prevent you from further lowering your weapon when you do strike.
speak;Alex;Understood. I'll give it another try.
speak;Forrest;There you go. I'm already seeing improvement.
speak;Alex;Thank you, General. I think I can handle practicing more on my own from here.
speak;Alex;However, there are more maneuvers in this manual I'm interested in learning.|Is it alright if I call upon you again if I need more assistance?

name: SupportForrestAlexA
_source: speak;Forrest;Excellent work, Alex.|You have made great strides with going through my father's combat manual.
speak;Alex;Thank you, General.|It's thanks to you that I have been able to do so.|Now there's just one last technique to go over.
speak;Forrest;Alright. I'm ready whenever you are.
speak;Alex;So, General, what did you think?
speak;Forrest;Overall, very good lancework. However, if I may{tgm}...
speak;Forrest;If you slide your hand down lower on the shaft like this{tgm}...
speak;Forrest;You'll find that it's a more balanced grip.|It won't be as much of a burden if you lower yourself down to this position.
speak;Forrest;There's no need to hold it as tightly as you did before.|With less stress on your hand, you have more energy to focus on other things.
speak;Forrest;I apologize, Alex. I didn't mean to--
speak;Alex;No, it's alright!|It just surprised me how willing you were to take on a more{tgm}...{tgm} hands-on approach.
speak;Alex;Just be more mindful of your words next time.|Especially when you're that close.
speak;Alex;Thank you for all your help, General Forrest.|If you don't mind, I think I'll call it here for today.
speak;Forrest;You're welcome, Alex. Have a good rest of your day.
speak;Forrest;And please get some rest. You look feverish.
speak;Alex;Ah, I-I'm fine. Thank you for your concern.
speak;Alex;Anyway, I'll be taking my leave. Until next time, General.
speak;Forrest;I hope she's feeling well.|She's been working hard, but I don't want her to overdo it.
speak;Forrest;And what did she mean about watching my words? Just what did I say earlier?
speak;Forrest;I don't think I said anything offensive, or{tgm}...

name: SupportForrestTorgen
_source: speak;Forrest;Torgen, do you have a moment?
speak;Forrest;I never had the opportunity to ask about this until now, but{tgm}...
speak;Torgen;Uh-huh? Come on, spit it out.
speak;Forrest;Or rather{tgm}...{tgm} How do I phrase this{tgm}...?
speak;Torgen;You wanna know why getting tied up turns her on.
speak;Forrest;I would have preferred a more subtle way of saying that, but yes.
speak;Torgen;See, I'm not one-hundred percent sure why she does, but I do have my theories.
speak;Torgen;Could be just that she likes it, no two ways about it.
speak;Torgen;Who knows?|Maybe getting kidnapped all those years ago made her discover something about herself.

speak;Torgen;I am! Not saying it could be the only reason.|There's also the chance the experience had the complete opposite effect.|She might've been traumatized so bad that this is her way of coping.
speak;Forrest;That is disturbing and I hope that is not the case.
speak;Torgen;Hey, like I said, I'm just theorizing.|Why don't you just ask her yourself if you're so curious?
speak;Forrest;I'd rather not. It's a{tgm}...{tgm} strange subject to talk about.
speak;Torgen;Hey, Forrest. I think I have an idea.
speak;Torgen;Why don't I try tying YOU up?
speak;Torgen;I'm just thinking that maybe you'll understand her point of view once you|get a feel for yourself.
speak;Forrest;An{tgm}...{tgm} interesting proposition. I'll consider it.
speak;Torgen;I'll give you time to think about it. Lemme know if you're down to do this.
speak;Forrest;I can't believe I agreed to this.
speak;Torgen;We can still call it quits before we even start.
speak;Forrest;No. I need to know why Her Highness finds this so appealing.
speak;Torgen;Alright then. Take off your armor.
speak;Torgen;What, do you WANT to have all that on when you're restrained?
# Forrest takes off his armor (Make new talk sprite)
speak;Torgen;Now, turn around and hands behind your back.
speak;Forrest;But I still wish to deepen my understanding.|Restrain me more. Maybe only tying the upper body isn't enough for me.
speak;Torgen;Whatever you say.|Here, let's sit you down in that chair there. I'll tie your legs together.
speak;Torgen;Well, there's one last thing I could do,|but I'm gonna need your permission for it.
speak;Torgen;I'll blindfold you and touch different parts of your body without warning.|I won't go for anything between the legs even if you agree to this.|I'll guarantee that.
speak;Torgen;I mean, unless you want me to.
speak;Forrest;That aside, what would be the point of this?
speak;Torgen;Taking away one of your senses will make you feel all helpless.|Maybe that's what Krista really likes about this.
speak;Forrest;But I'm willing to try anything now. You may blindfold me, Torgen.
speak;Torgen;Now, I'd usually gag Krista at this point too,|but that defeats the purpose of getting feedback from you.|So, just lemme know if you notice anything, alright?
speak;Forrest;(He's not doing anything. He wouldn't just leave me like this, would he?)|(No, of course not. But what if--)
speak;Torgen;You were starting to squirm a bit.
speak;Torgen;I think we're starting to get somewhere, though.
speak;Forrest;(Okay. Focus.)|(There has to be a reason why Krista likes this.)|(If I can understand that, then maybe--)
speak;Torgen;Well, that sure was a noise.
speak;Forrest;(My voice just came out on its own...!)|(It was such an indecent sound too...)|(What... What is coming over me?)
speak;Forrest;I need to be alone with my thoughts.
speak;Torgen;And don't worry. I won't tell anyone about this.
speak;Forrest;Did I feel helpless just now{tgm}...?
speak;Forrest;No, not exactly. It was something else I felt.
speak;Forrest;And I{tgm}...{tgm} didn't hate it, per se.

name: SupportForrestMichael
_source: speak;Forrest;Excellent lance work, Michael. Very impressive.
speak;Michael;Oh, Sir Forrest! Th-Thank you very much.|How long were you standing there for?
speak;Forrest;Not for too long. However, I can see that your technique is serviceable.|This is due to your training with Foliaga's Holy Knights, I assume?
speak;Forrest;It's a huge decision to become a knight in the first place.|What drove you to pursue this?
speak;Michael;The stories, sir.|Knights always helped and protected the needy and downtrodden.|It made me want to do my part.
speak;Forrest;Commendable. I had no such lofty aspirations, myself.|I simply followed my father's footsteps.
speak;Forrest;Although, Michael, I must ask:|are you prepared to die as a knight?
speak;Forrest;We are knights, Michael. We protect the realm and our liege with no hesitation.
speak;Forrest;So, I ask again.|Are you willing to die in the name of your country, Michael?
speak;Michael;I{tgm}...{tgm} I had not considered that, sir.
speak;Michael;In the stories, the knights never died.|They slay dragons and rescue villagers with no trouble at all.
speak;Forrest;This isn't a story Michael. Real life does not fall into such ideals.
speak;Michael;I know, sir. It's just the prospect hadn't settled in.|I guess with comrades and other knights,|I thought I would be able to return home again.
speak;Forrest;I advise that you put more thought into the decision you have made, Michael.|You must be sure you are prepared for the road ahead.

name: SupportKristaFelicityB
_source: speak;Maid2;Y-Your Highness! Was there something you needed?
speak;Krista;But, Glenda, aren't you supposed to be scrubbing the floors in the west wing?
speak;Krista;And Helen, aren't you supposed to be dusting in the main hall?
speak;Maid2;We'll be on our way now.
speak;Krista;Felicity, you can come out now.|I know you're around here somewhere.
speak;Krista;How much of that did you hear?
speak;Felicity;Enough to know their thoughts on me haven't changed at all.
speak;Krista;Do the other maids always talk behind your back like this?
speak;Felicity;It doesn't matter if they do or not.|They can think whatever they want about me. I don't care.
speak;Krista;You may not care, but I do.|I'm gonna give them a proper talking to when I get the chance.
speak;Felicity;I appreciate it, Your Highness, but it's best if you don't.|It would only get worse if you interfered.
speak;Felicity;They'd twist the situation to make it look like I'm currying favor with you and|further feed into their negative perceptions of me.
speak;Felicity;Let them believe what they want to believe, Your Highness.|You know me for who I am, and that's all that matters to me.
speak;Krista;But still, it's cruel of them to hate you and not even try to get to know you.
speak;Felicity;Some people will just hate you no matter what you do, Your Highness.|And no amount of persuasion will change their mind.
speak;Felicity;I learned that a long time ago.
speak;Krista;You can depend on me, you know?|If things get tough, or you just need someone to listen, I'll be here. Okay?
speak;Felicity;If only you could return the favor just as easily, Your Highness.
speak;Felicity;You know exactly what I'm talking about.
speak;Felicity;Now, if you'll excuse me, I must be getting back to my chores.
speak;Krista;But if that's the case, why didn't she tell me?

name: SupportKristaFelicity
_source: speak;Krista;Sorry I'm late, Felicity. I had way more stuff to do today than I thought.
speak;Krista;Anyway, ready to do the shopping together?
speak;Felicity;No need, Your Highness. I had finished the shopping this morning on my own.
speak;Krista;Oh! You've been doing that a lot lately, huh?
speak;Krista;Not that I mind, of course.
speak;Krista;It's good to see you getting more used to dealing with crowds.
speak;Felicity;Actually, I arrived at the marketplace early enough when it was mostly quiet.
speak;Krista;Oh, really?|Still, thanks for all your help, Felicity. Just don't push yourself too hard, okay?|I know that dealing with people can be tough sometimes.
speak;Felicity;At any rate, I have more chores to attend to. If you'll excuse me{tgm}...
speak;Krista;I wonder what that was about.

name: SupportAquaSemi
_source: speak;Aqua;I'm doing well. Thank you for asking.
speak;Semi;All this time tagging along with the princess hasn't taken a toll on you, has it?
speak;Semi;You sure?|You've been running across the battlefield left and right tending to everyone's wounds.|Isn't that tiring you out?
speak;Aqua;Semi, I assure you I'm fine!
speak;Aqua;{tgm}...{tgm} Was us being captured by those bandits still on your mind?
speak;Aqua;You don't have to worry so much about me.|I know things have been hectic,|but now we have Her Highness and the Medean royal army by our side!|They can protect us.
speak;Semi;Hmph. I trust these guys as far as I can throw 'em.
speak;Semi;Besides, even if I did actually trust them, it still wouldn't matter.
speak;Semi;I'll be the one to protect you, Aqua. Always.|That's how it's always been.
speak;Semi;It might as well have been.
speak;Semi;I'm gonna do what Azure didn't do for years, Aqua.|I don't care what his reasons were for leaving.|He still left, and that's all that matters.|I'll be there for you.

name: SupportAquaAzure
_source: speak;Aqua;Azure, how has traveling with the troupe been so far?
speak;Azure;Quite well.|You know, once they knew I had a sister,|they begged me to take you along with us if we stopped near the monastery again.
speak;Azure;They would go on and on about meeting you.
speak;Azure;"Oh, Azure, why are you hiding your sister from us?"|"Is she as cute as you are?"
speak;Aqua;I wouldn't even know what I would do if I came with you, though.
speak;Aqua;I don't play an instrument, my singing voice isn't all that great,|and I don't know the first thing about dancing.
speak;Azure;I didn't either before I joined them.
speak;Aqua;But you've always been so graceful with your movements.|Becoming a dancer just seemed so natural for you.
speak;Azure;Really now? Since we're twins, I'd imagine some of that grace is in you too.
speak;Azure;Sure I do. In fact, we can prove that easily.|I'll teach you one of the first dances I learned while in the troupe.|If you can grasp that, then that'll be proof enough.
speak;Aqua;Hmm{tgm}...{tgm} If anything, it sounds like it would be fun.

name: SupportAquaAlex
_source: speak;Aqua;Now, let's see, what can I top this with?
speak;Aqua;Oh, pineapple! I've always wanted to try pineapple.
speak;Aqua;Something sweet like this should go with something savory{tgm}...{tgm}|Maybe the ham?
speak;Alex;Aqua? What might you be doing in the kitchen?
speak;Aqua;Oh, hello, Alex! I just wanted to make myself a light snack before bed.
speak;Alex;This seems like a lot for a "light" snack.|What do you plan on doing with all of this?

speak;Aqua;I wanted to try to recreate a popular dish from southern Foliaga.|You take slices of bread and top it with tomato, cheese, a bit of garlic, and meat.|Typically thinly sliced pork or sausage.
speak;Alex;But if that's what you're making, why the pineapple?
speak;Aqua;I wanted to experiment with more exotic ingredients.|It's a rare opportunity to have access to ingredients from all over Yondo.
speak;Alex;Being in Medeas does have its perks.
speak;Aqua;Mm-hm! Oh, while you're here, why don't you try some?
speak;Alex;A-Ah, are you sure{tgm}...?{tgm} I mean{tgm}...
speak;Alex;I'm all for experimenting in the kitchen, but pineapple with ham?;;;thought_bubble
speak;Alex;And the tomato and the garlic too... I'm not so sure about this.;;;thought_bubble
speak;Alex;I'd love to, really, but{tgm}...{tgm} I'm still quite full from dinner earlier.
speak;Alex;So maybe some other time, Aqua.
speak;Aqua;That's okay! More for me, then.

name: SupportForrestJake
_source: speak;Forrest;Jake, may I ask you for some advice?
speak;Jake;Well, sure thing, Sir Forrest! What's troubling ya?
speak;Forrest;I{tgm}...{tgm} well{tgm}...{tgm} This is embarrassing, but{tgm}...
speak;Jake;Is that all? No need to be so shy about it!|So, who's the lucky lady?
speak;Jake;I mean, if I have an idea who the girl is, I could give ya better advice.
speak;Forrest;I would feel more comfortable if you gave me more general advice, then.
speak;Jake;If you say so.|So, first thing's first. You gotta get on this girl's good side.|Listen to her problems, do little things for her, stuff like that.
speak;Forrest;I do a lot of that already.
speak;Jake;There we go! You're already ahead of the game here.
speak;Jake;From there, you drop subtle hints that you like her.|Key word here: SUBTLE.
speak;Forrest;But, it still worked, correct?{br}You and Anna--
speak;Jake;There were other girls before Anna.
speak;Jake;But yeah, subtlety is your best friend. Don't forget it!
speak;Forrest;I apologize, Jake, but subtlety has not made any noticeable difference.
speak;Jake;Huh, really? If that's the case, then might as well just be upfront with her!
speak;Forrest;N-No! That is not an option.
speak;Jake;Alright, alright. I think I see what the problem is.
speak;Jake;Sir Forrest, what you need is to work on your confidence!
speak;Jake;Yup! Once we get that confidence up, you can get your girl, guaranteed!
speak;Forrest;I suppose we can try that.
speak;Jake;Great! I'm gonna brainstorm some ideas for confidence boosters.|I'll check back in with ya later.

name: SupportForrestNagisa
_source: speak;Nagisa;Well, well, the floozy's guard dog is out on the training yard today?
speak;Nagisa;Is there anyone else out here?
speak;Forrest;I don't think you realize you're walking a fine line here, Nagisa.
speak;Forrest;I've said that disrespect towards Her Highness wouldn't be taken lightly.
speak;Forrest;And I am a man of my word.
speak;Nagisa;Was that a javelin? An ACTUAL javelin?!
speak;Forrest;The only reason I missed is because Her Highness wouldn't approve of me{tgm}...{tgm}|disposing of an ally.
speak;Forrest;Although, calling you an ally is a stretch.
speak;Forrest;If you value your life, I suggest you learn to hold your tongue.|Now, if we're done here, I shall resume my training.

name: SupportXiangTaiga
_source: speak;Taiga;Yo! Xiang! Mind helping me with something?|It's something only you can do.
speak;Xiang;I suppose. For what do you need my assistance?
speak;Taiga;There's no time to explain, just follow me!
speak;Man1;Oh, Taiga. Here to lose all your gold again?
speak;Taiga;Not this time! I got a lucky charm on me.|Right, Xiang?
speak;Man2;Not like it's gonna make a difference.|Here, let's deal you in.
speak;Taiga;<brown>Aw, dammit. This hand's total garbage.|Xiang, what should I do?</brown>
speak;Taiga;<brown>You can see what the next cards are in the deck, right?|So, what should I keep?</brown>
speak;Xiang;<brown>This is the reason for bringing me here?</brown>
speak;Man1;Hey, what are you two whispering about?!|Get on with it, Taiga.
speak;Taiga;Alright, alright! Don't rush me, old man!
speak;Man2;Well, Taiga, looks like you're completely broke. Again.
speak;Taiga;Come on, Xiang. Let's get out of here.
speak;Taiga;Argh, that was a disaster!|You didn't help me at all!
speak;Xiang;How am I supposed to help you when I had no idea what was going on?
speak;Taiga;Wait, you don't know how to play poker?
speak;Taiga;Aw, Merin, so THAT was the problem!
speak;Taiga;Guess I probably should have asked first.
speak;Xiang;That would have been a wise decision, yes.
speak;Taiga;Alright, alright. I'm gonna teach you poker.
speak;Taiga;And next time, we'll show those geezers what we're made of!
speak;Taiga;Alright, let's review.|Name off each hand, highest to lowest!
speak;Xiang;Royal Flush, Straight Flush,{br}Four of a Kind, Full House,|Flush, Straight, Three of a Kind, Two Pair, Pair, High Card.
speak;Taiga;Now the suits, highest to lowest.
speak;Taiga;And the highest ranked cards are?
speak;Taiga;Aw yeah, we're definitely ready now!|To the gambling hall!
speak;Man1;So, Taiga's back with her "lucky charm," huh?
speak;Taiga;She's super lucky now! We're gonna win big today!
speak;Xiang;<brown>Discarding two of your cards has a high chance of winning this round.</brown>
speak;Taiga;<brown>Okay, but which ones should I lose?</brown>
speak;Taiga;<brown>What do ya mean you don't know?!<brown>
speak;Man1;Ha! Your lucky charm having trouble there, Taiga?
speak;Taiga;Shut your trap! Just give me a sec here, alright?!
speak;Man2;So this is what you call "winning big," Taiga?
speak;Taiga;What the hell was that?!|That was even worse than last time!|I thought you could see the future.
speak;Xiang;I can see the future, but not its exact outcomes.|I can only see where the paths lead.
speak;Taiga;You could have told me that earlier.
speak;Taiga;I know we can actually win next time.|We just gotta figure out what your powers are trying telling us.
speak;Taiga;So, once we figure out a system, we'll win for sure!
speak;Taiga;Okay, so, what about this hand?
speak;Taiga;If it's three cards, then maybe it's a Full House?|I've already got a pair of threes here. Let's see{tgm}...
speak;Taiga;Hey, a Four of a Kind! Even better!
speak;Taiga;Okay, Xiang, I think we got it down this time.|We'll really show 'em what we've got now!
speak;Man1;Ready to empty your coin pouch?
speak;Taiga;Not this time, old man! Third time's the charm.
speak;Man2;I'm all for some easy gold. Let's deal you in, Taiga.
speak;Taiga;If it's two cards, then it's probably a Straight.|We've got a five, six, and seven here already.|A bit weak, but it's our best option here.;;;thought_bubble
speak;Man2;Alright. Here are your new cards.
speak;Taiga;Straight with a High Card of nine. Not bad.;;;thought_bubble
speak;Man2;Okay. Time to show your hands.
speak;Man1;Oh, pipe down. You won one hand. So what?
speak;Taiga;I'm tellin' ya, my lucky charm's the best.|Right, Xiang?
speak;Man2;Alright, alright. Place your antes, you two.
speak;Taiga;And that brings me up to 10,000 gold.
speak;Taiga;Nope, not in the slightest.|No cards up our sleeves, no mirrors, no nothing.|Just me and my lucky charm.
speak;Taiga;Anyway, good game, boys.|Me and Xiang are gonna head home. 'Til next time!
speak;Taiga;We did it, Xiang! All our hard work finally paid off.|So, how do you wanna celebrate?
speak;Taiga;Don't be so modest!|If it weren't for your powers, we wouldn't be rolling in gold right now.
speak;Xiang;That is not completely true.|You were the one who chose what cards to keep per round.|Your knowledge of poker helped too.
speak;Taiga;Y'know, you have a point.|Still, I've been asking a lot outta you this entire time.|I think you should take the helm on this one.
speak;Xiang;In that case, could we play poker together? No stakes, just for fun.
speak;Taiga;Ha! You really liked all that, huh?
speak;Taiga;But that's unfair, don't you think?|You're the one who can see the future here.

speak;Xiang;As I have said before, I cannot see the exact outcomes.|You have more practical experience with the game,|so you can logically figure out what could be a better hand.|I would say we are evenly matched.
speak;Taiga;Hm{tgm}...{tgm} Never thought about it that way.
speak;Taiga;Alright, that settles it! You're on, Xiang!
speak;Taiga;Hey, Xiang! Up for another game of poker?
speak;Taiga;Awesome! And let's make this one a real high-stakes game.
speak;Xiang;Er, what does that entail exactly?
speak;Taiga;If I win, then you gotta marry me. If you win, I gotta marry you!
speak;Taiga;Don't think about it too hard!|Come on, I'll get the deck shuffled then we can start. Best three hands out of five.
speak;Taiga;And that's another loss for me.
speak;Taiga;Looks like you win my hand in marriage, Xiang.
speak;Taiga;Wanna know the best part? I got a ring ready right here!|So you don't have to worry about getting one yourself.
speak;Xiang;So, you were planning on winning?
speak;Taiga;That was the idea, yeah. But since you won, you gotta do it.
speak;Taiga;I gotta be the one married to you, not the other way around{tgm}...
speak;Xiang;Could you please repeat the stakes of the game for me one more time?
speak;Taiga;If I win, you marry me, and if you win, I marry you.
speak;Xiang;Now, just{tgm}...{tgm} Think about what you just said.

name: SupportTaigaYumi
_source: speak;Yumi;Do you see the path to camp? I sure don't.
speak;Taiga;Aw, we don't need some dumb path!
speak;Taiga;If I remember right, we were heading north of camp to get supplies.|Then that just means we need to head south.
speak;Taiga;A great question. Look up at the sky.|See that really bright star up there?
speak;Taiga;I've been using that one as a guide since we headed out 'cause it's always pointing north.|So we just gotta walk the opposite direction and we'll be back at camp in no time!
speak;Yumi;Okay, I'm trusting you on this.
speak;Taiga;Of course I was! I ain't the navigator for the Wyrmfang Pirates for nothing.
speak;Yumi;That was really useful to know, Taiga.|I would've been wandering that forest for ages if you weren't there.
speak;Taiga;Y'know, that gives me an idea. I'll teach you more about the stars!|That way, you can navigate on your own.|You'll never know if I won't be around to help you out.
speak;Yumi;That's a good point. I'll take you up on that, Taiga.
speak;Taiga;Great! Just lemme know when you've got a free night, alright?

name: SupportForrestTrevor
_source: speak;Forrest;So, Trevor, how have you been lately?|Not too stressed from your first time on the battlefield, I hope.
speak;Trevor;Why, I have been doing quite well, thank you.|Fighting alongside you, Her Highness, and everyone else has been most exhilarating.
speak;Forrest;That's a relief to hear.|Most people can't handle being in the heat of battle.|I know when I was still a squire,|just the thought of hurting someone else made me uneasy.
speak;Trevor;Is that so? That is difficult to believe, in my opinion.
speak;Trevor;Why, look at you now!|You have been protecting Her Highness from ruffians left and right like|a true knight should.
speak;Forrest;Most of those rescue missions were unnecessary, but yes.
speak;Forrest;I have gotten used to upholding my duties as Princess Krista's knight.
speak;Trevor;Just how do you do it, Forrest?|I am sure this change of heart did not happen overnight.
speak;Forrest;No, it didn't. It felt like it did, though.|I had to do a lot of self-reflection after Princess Krista|was first kidnapped by bandits five years ago.
speak;Forrest;Yes. This was back when Sam was still with us.|And unlike the many times after this one,|this kidnapping was not deliberate on Krista's part.
speak;Trevor;That must have been a traumatic experience. At least one would assume so.|And if that were the case, why would Her Highness keep letting herself--
speak;Forrest;Don't ask questions you're not prepared to hear the answer to, Trevor.
speak;Trevor;Understood. {tgm}...{tgm} I think.|Regardless, please continue, Forrest.

speak;Forrest;We were young when it happened. I would have been around your age, in fact.|The princess was not in any danger before that point,|so it never occurred to me that I would have to raise my sword to serve her.|Not until that day.

speak;Forrest;Trevor, while I am glad you can hold your own,|do not forget your duties as Princess Krista's retainer.|You have to be there to protect her no matter what.|That is your number one priority.
speak;Forrest;Trevor, just what were you doing out there during the last battle?!|If I weren't close by, Her Highness would have--
speak;Trevor;Do you think I don't know that?!|By Medea, Forrest, when there's that many enemies surrounding us,|there's only so much I can do.|Some of us aren't as brawny as you are.
