speak;Forrest;That is no excuse. Remember what I said before?|Protecting Princess Krista is your top priority.
speak;Trevor;Are you suggesting my own life is not as important as hers?
speak;Trevor;Do you even comprehend your own words right now, Forrest?|It is one thing to serve Her Highness, but to throw one's own life away so carelessly?|That is inconceivable!

speak;Forrest;Then, I'm afraid you will have to reconsider your position as her retainer, Trevor.|It's a difficult concept to grasp, I know. But it is necessary.|Princess Krista is Medeas' future queen. Without her, the kingdom will fall.
speak;Trevor;But even so, what if we were gone?|Who would be there to protect her?
speak;Forrest;There{tgm}...{tgm} There are other knights and mages, Trevor.|We{tgm}...{tgm} can be replaced if need be.
speak;Trevor;You do not honestly believe that, do you?
speak;Forrest;It does not matter what my personal feelings are. This is just the reality of the situation.
speak;Forrest;I{tgm}...{tgm} have come to accept that a long time ago.
speak;Trevor;{tgm}...{tgm} Are you sure about that?
speak;Forrest;Look. We are done here, Trevor.|Just think about what I said.|Do not let Her Highness be in peril again.
speak;Trevor;Despite what you may say, I am not the only one who has to think about this, Forrest.
speak;Trevor;Forrest, are you well? You seemed distracted during the last battle.
speak;Forrest;That is just your imagination, Trevor. I'm perfectly fine.
speak;Trevor;I am not so sure about that.|You were so focused on your own actions, you paid no attention to anything else around you.
speak;Trevor;Seeing you waver like this is unusual, and quite frankly, it worries me.|I wish to help you if something is troubling you, Forrest.|You are my friend, after all.
speak;Forrest;I was thinking about our discussion from some time ago.|I know I said we could be replaced, but{tgm}...{tgm}|I wish to remain at Her Highness' side for as long as I can.
speak;Forrest;The fear of losing her overwhelmed me, I suppose.
speak;Trevor;So, there IS a human heart beneath all that armor.

speak;Forrest;This may sound selfish of me,|but I do not wish to entrust her life to someone else's hands.|To tell you the truth, when Her Highness brought in Felicity, then Kai, then you...|I had my doubts about you all. But you proved your worth eventually.
speak;Trevor;I am not sure if I should be elated or offended.
speak;Forrest;I apologize. I'm not very good at this.
speak;Trevor;Do not fret. I know you meant well.|I admire your honesty even if you can be blunt about it at times.
speak;Forrest;May I confess something to you?|I actually haven't said the whole truth.
speak;Forrest;I may be upholding my duties as Princess Krista's knight, but ultimately, I{tgm}...
speak;Forrest;That's why I can't let her go to anyone else.
speak;Trevor;I can understand the sentiment, Forrest.
speak;Trevor;Ah, nothing. Pay me no mind.
speak;Trevor;At any rate, let us continue to do good work together.

name: SupportForrestChell
_source: speak;Forrest;Yes, I am. Was there something you needed?
speak;Chell;I finished gathering firewood, so I wanted to see if you needed assistance.
speak;Forrest;That would be much appreciated. Thank you, Chell.
speak;Chell;One moment, isn't that Princess Krista's blouse?|I didn't know you took care of her laundry as well.
speak;Forrest;I typically don't. That's Felicity's job.|She's busy catching up on her other duties, so I'm taking over for her.
speak;Chell;Is that so?|And you don't feel awkward handling a woman's clothing?
speak;Forrest;The way you phrased that made me feel more awkward about it|than me actually doing it.
speak;Forrest;But in all seriousness, no.{br}I don't.|I had to take over for Felicity a few times over the years,|and it was embarrassing for a while.|But ultimately, it was something I got used to.
speak;Forrest;Is there something on your mind?
speak;Chell;Nothing in particular.|It's just with how well you perform your duties around the castle,|I think you'd make a good husband one day.
speak;Chell;I apologize. That did not come out as I intended.|I didn't mean to imply that you and I would{tgm}...
speak;Forrest;It's alright. I'll take it as a compliment.
speak;Chell;Forrest, have you thought about having children one day?
speak;Forrest;What's with this sudden question?|Wait, is this related to our discussion the other day?
speak;Chell;Yes, it is, actually.|So, has it ever crossed your mind?
speak;Forrest;It hasn't.|Well, I mean, it has, but{tgm}...
speak;Chell;You'd want Her Highness to be the mother?
speak;Forrest;Chell, don't say such things out loud! It's not proper.
speak;Chell;Allow me to be frank, but everyone and their mother knows you have feelings for|Princess Krista.
speak;Chell;Yes. It has been that obvious for years.
speak;Chell;Pardon me for being overly critical, but it's to the point where it's almost pitiful.
speak;Forrest;Your words wound me, Chell.|Though, I suppose this is something I needed to hear.
speak;Chell;There is more to life than her, you know.
speak;Forrest;That is easy for you to say.|Protecting Her Highness, staying by her side...|This life with her is all I've ever known, Chell.|I cannot stray from it so easily.
speak;Chell;But what if you could?|What if one day, you were no longer were duty-bound to her?
speak;Forrest;That's{tgm}...{tgm} I can't even begin to imagine such a life.
speak;Chell;Maybe you should.|There could be a time when she isn't here.|You never know what could happen in the future.
speak;Forrest;A time when she isn't here{tgm}...
speak;Chell;Forrest? Do you mind if I ask you something?
speak;Chell;Do you think I would make a good mother?
speak;Forrest;Still on that train of thought?|What brought this on specifically?
speak;Chell;I can't help but think I could have done better.
speak;Forrest;Chell, you're her sister. Not her mother.|What more could you have done?
speak;Chell;I know, but ever since Mother and Father were gone, I had to be the one there for her.|Was I too tough on her? Did I say something wrong? I--
speak;Forrest;Chell, stop. Don't beat yourself up over this.|You tried your best given the circumstances.

speak;Forrest;You were young.|And the pain of losing a mother not only affected her, but you as well.|You had it just as hard, if not harder than she did.|No one should blame you for her leaving. Especially not yourself.

speak;Forrest;You're a strong woman, Chell.|Your future children would be lucky to have a mother like you.|And you won't be alone in raising them either.|Your future husband would be there by your side.
speak;Chell;I{tgm}...{tgm} Yes, you're right.|Thank you, Forrest.
speak;Forrest;Chell, may I speak to you for a moment?
speak;Forrest;I{tgm}...{tgm} Oh, Medea, this is nerve-wracking.
speak;Chell;I've never seen you like this before.|What's gotten you so nervous?

speak;Forrest;I just{tgm}...{tgm} Allow me to be frank with you.|I said before that your future husband would support you in raising a family.|When I told you that, I never imagined I would refer to myself.
speak;Chell;Wait, what are you trying to say?

speak;Forrest;I've considered my options, and I believe this path is best for me.|You were right. There is more to life than serving Her Highness.|Chell, you've opened my eyes to a world I have not seen before,|and I will forever be thankful for that.|Would you{tgm}...{tgm} be willing to expand my world further?
speak;Chell;Absolutely! Oh, Forrest, of course I'll marry you.
speak;Forrest;Chell, I{tgm}...{tgm} Please be patient with me on this.|This{tgm}...{tgm} This is all very new to me.
speak;Chell;We're in this together. You said so yourself.|I'll support you as long as you do the same for me.

name: SupportChellSamA
_source: speak;Sam;Oh!! You thought I was talking about your b--

name: SupportAlexJoshua
_source: speak;Alex;Hello, Joshua. I didn't expect to see you here in the library.
speak;Joshua;Hey there, Alex. Figured I'd unwind after training by doing some reading.
speak;Alex;I never would have taken you for a reader Joshua.|You come off as more{tgm}...{tgm} abrasive, honestly.
speak;Alex;A lot like Taylor, actually.|And getting HIM to read anything is like getting a child to eat their greens.
speak;Joshua;You gotta keep your mind sharp if you want to survive in the arena.|Both mind and body need to be strong.
speak;Alex;I can agree with that sentiment.
speak;Alex;Though, I fear it's my mind that's more strong than my body.
speak;Joshua;Don't sell yourself short, Alex. You strike me as a strong, capable woman.
speak;Joshua;However, if you want some help, these books might do the trick.|I'll leave them with you.
speak;Joshua;No problem. I'll catch you later. Reading makes me hungry.
speak;Alex;"10 Lifts for Life", "Meat Makes Muscle", and "Train Like a Champion, Be a Champion"{tgm}...
speak;Alex;These aren't something I normally read, but they seem interesting.

name: SupportAlexEcco
_source: # Could be a base convo instead #
speak;Alex;How did I end up with all these books?|I'm usually more responsible with my spending.
speak;Ecco;Yoo-hoo! Alex! You out on a shopping spree too?
speak;Alex;I meant to only get one or two books,|and next thing I know, I have a whole bookcase worth.
speak;Ecco;We are going to be best friends. I can feel it.
speak;Ecco;Anyway, you need to relax.|There's nothing wrong with a little impromptu, impulsive shopping.
speak;Ecco;Eh, I wouldn't worry about it. Who's going to get hurt by it?
speak;Ecco;By the way, there's this new pastry shop that opened. You have to try it.|They have all kinds of sweets. And coffee too!
speak;Ecco;Oh! And they have this new drink! A pumpkin spice latte!
speak;Alex;I've already spent so much. I really shouldn't.
speak;Ecco;You gotta live a little, good grief! C'mon, it'll be fun.
speak;Alex;Well, I suppose a little taste couldn't hurt.
speak;Ecco;That's the spirit! And after this, let's go get some ice cream and|we can complain about stupid exes.
speak;Alex;I haven't even dated to begin with.

name: SupportSamEcco
_source: # Could be a base convo instead #
speak;Ecco;Man, it's getting really hard finding jobs that will pay.|Where's all the good jobs?
speak;Ecco;Hey, where's all the bandit jobs? Shouldn't there be more of those?
speak;GuildGirl;Oh, Oreg, here he is now.
speak;Sam;Guess what?! You won't believe it!
speak;GuildGirl;Let me guess. You killed all the bandits, didn't you, Sam?
speak;Sam;Sure did! Got any more word of bandits?
speak;Ecco;He's the reason you don't have any bandit assignments, huh?
speak;Ecco;That's all I need to know.
speak;Sam;Oh baby! Daddy is coming for you!!|I'm gonna put you to sleep!
speak;Sam;Don't startle me like that! You almost gave me a heart attack.|What do you want?
speak;Ecco;You've been killing a lot of bandits lately.
speak;Sam;There was Pig Nose, Cut Ear, Eyeless,|Ugly Face, Ugly Face Two, Ugly Face Three--
speak;Sam;Oh, and also their six cousins--
speak;Ecco;There's just a teeny, tiny problem.
speak;Ecco;Because of you, the rest of us mercenaries can't get any jobs!|You're getting all the money from the bandit killing and not leaving any for us.
speak;Sam;Wait a minute, you can get paid for this?! What for?
speak;Ecco;Yes, you can get paid! What do you think mercenaries do this for?|How do you maintain your equipment?
speak;Sam;Oh, that's easy. I just take the bandits' weapons.|Plus, I don't use armor anyway.
speak;Ecco;Well, I need to replenish my tomes!
speak;Sam;Is that what this is all about? I have plenty at my house. Follow me!
speak;Sam;Here we go. One blinky blink book for you.
speak;Ecco;{tgm}...{tgm} Did you seriously just call it a "blinky blink book"?

name: SupportRyuujiTsubaki
_source: speak;Ryuuji;I've been doing some thinking lately, and I think we should drop formalities now.
speak;Ryuuji;I'm not under your service anymore,|so I don't see any reason to keep seeing you as my liege.|You're just some little girl in my eyes now.
speak;Ryuuji;So, instead of "Lady Tsubaki",|I'd say something like Tsuba or Baki would be more appropriate.

speak;Tsubaki;Hold for a moment! What's with those nicknames?|A-And more importantly, you may not be my retainer anymore,|but I'm still next in line to the throne.|There should still be some level of respect.
speak;Ryuuji;You know what? You have a point.
speak;Ryuuji;But, y'know, you gotta earn that respect.
speak;Ryuuji;Let's see you live up to being the emperor's daughter.|Once you do that, maybe I'll see you as Lady Tsubaki again.|Until then, you're still just a little girl.
speak;Tsubaki;I know he's always been rough around the edges,|but being with that pirate crew made him worse!
speak;Tsubaki;Still, his brashness has always had an appeal{tgm}...

name: SupportRyuujiNagisa
_source: speak;Ryuuji;I know I ain't in any position to be saying this,|but you really gotta cool it around the Medeans.
speak;Ryuuji;Like it or not, we're all allies here.|On top of that, you're Tsubaki's retainer.|What you say is gonna be taken like Samegoro said it himself.
speak;Ryuuji;Man, why do I even gotta explain this to you?
speak;Ryuuji;You of all people should get that!
speak;Nagisa;And you of all people shouldn't be lecturing me on alliances, you dirty traitor.
speak;Ryuuji;Heh, on one hand, I get where you're coming from.
speak;Ryuuji;But honestly? That just shows how ignorant you are.
speak;Ryuuji;Like I said, you of all people should know what I'm getting at.|You ain't a kid anymore, Nagisa.
speak;Ryuuji;Or maybe you still need me to hold your hand?
speak;Nagisa;Oh, shove it! Don't think you can still tease me like that.
speak;Ryuuji;Except I ain't teasin'. Seriously, what's gotten into you?
speak;Nagisa;You{tgm}...{tgm} You just don't get it!

name: SupportKaiJoshua
_source: speak;Kai;Hm{tgm}...{tgm} Fascinating.|That hunk of iron doesn't slow him down nearly as much as one would expect.|He doesn't parry or deflect like one might with a large sword.|More like he cuts through his opponent's defenses. Interesting.
speak;Joshua;Hey, you going to spar, pretty boy?|Or are you just going to stand on the sidelines all day like an idiotic bystander?
speak;Joshua;You see anyone else just grinning on the sidelines not doing anything?
speak;Kai;Doesn't that large sword weigh you down, though?|I would think something that massive would--
speak;Joshua;Oh no you don't. You've been watching for the better part of half an hour.|Quit standing there and draw! Hyah!
speak;Kai;You were aware that I was watching even while sparring yourself?
speak;Joshua;First rule of survival in the arena:|always be aware of your surroundings and who occupies them.|Anyone there is a potential assassin, adversary, or ambusher.
speak;Kai;So you have good situational awareness, then. You would make a good soldier or spy.|Still, this sword is a large target making it easy to avoid and block.
speak;Joshua;You may have blocked my blade, but look at your own.

speak;Joshua;As you noted, large target so easy to block.|But if you block near my crossguard, you are bearing the full weight of Old Iron here,|which is too much strain for the typical blade.|One more parry and you may break your sword.
speak;Joshua;What you want to do is block closer to the tip.|Less weight on your blade.
speak;Joshua;Let's call it for a day. Besides, you need to get your sword looked at.
speak;Kai;How did he get my sword to the point of breaking like that?
speak;Kai;Thank Merin it didn't actually break.
speak;Kai;Going to have to find more information on him.
speak;Kai;Maybe I'll see if anyone from there knows anything about the man.

name: SupportKaiAsuka
_source: speak;Kai;Nice to see you too, Asuka.
speak;Asuka;You know very well what the consequences are for defecting, Kai.|And as much as I would like to follow through with them, I can't exactly do that.
speak;Kai;Aw, you still care about me.
speak;Asuka;When did you pick up that insufferable attitude?
speak;Kai;It's always been there. I was just good at hiding it.
speak;Kai;Now, are you gonna keep holding me like this, or should I just break free myself?
speak;Kai;You couldn't have honestly believed I wouldn't know how to break out of that hold.|It was my father's technique. You know that.
speak;Asuka;I assumed you'd be rusty after all this time.
speak;Kai;So, what's the deal, Asuka?|I'm sure getting your hands on me wasn't the reason for your "visit".
speak;Kai;I mean, I know I look like my old man, but come on--
speak;Kai;Hmm, not hearing you deny it.
speak;Asuka;You are just trying to distract me. I will not give in so easily.
speak;Asuka;This was just a warning, Kai.|Once our time with the Medean princess is over, I will not show you mercy.|Watch yourself.
speak;Kai;Man, I know I was just trying to rile her up, but{tgm}...
speak;Kai;I'm not playing around anymore, Asuka. Gonna have to try harder than that.
speak;Kai;Hey, what happened to not killing me, hm?
speak;Asuka;You're making me reconsider, Kai. Choose your next words carefully.
speak;Kai;"Good job, Su-chan. You've really improved."
speak;Kai;What's wrong?|I thought you would've missed being called by that nickname.
speak;Kai;If you want me to keep going, I can.
speak;Kai;In fact, I'll even throw in my "services" if you feel so inclined.
speak;Kai;Wouldn't be offering if I wasn't.
speak;Kai;He and I went through similar training, y'know.|I bet I look just like him in his prime.
speak;Kai;Just a little bit of gold, and you can see for yourself, Asuka.
speak;Asuka;{tgm}...{tgm} Even you can admit this is going too far, Kai.
speak;Kai;Maybe. But your hesitation is giving me mixed signals.
speak;Kai;Think about it. No one will know but us.
speak;Kai;Keeping secrets is literally what ninjas are trained to do, after all.
speak;Kai;So, it is up for consideration, then?
speak;Kai;Hmm{tgm}...{tgm} but even if she did accept, would I really have it in me to follow through on it?
speak;Kai;Ugh, just thinking about pretending to be him is making me sick{tgm}...

name: SupportAquaMichael
_source: speak;Aqua;And may the Great Folia bless those who walked this path on days gone by,|and through time forever passing.
speak;Aqua;Oh, Michael! I didn't realize you were standing there.|If you wanted to pray alongside me, you could have asked.
speak;Michael;Well, uh, it's not like I didn't want to pray, but{tgm}...
speak;Michael;I wanted to ask you something.
speak;Michael;Please don't be offended,|but how can you keep worshipping the Great Folia like this?
speak;Michael;I'm sorry! That was really rude, wasn't it?
speak;Michael;You know what, I'll just go.
speak;Aqua;{tgm}...{tgm} Just what did the Holy Knights do to you, Michael?

name: SupportAquaLucy
_source: speak;Aqua;Yes, that's me. Who are you?
speak;Lucy;I'm Lucy, a healer for the Medean royal army.
speak;Lucy;Well, healer in training, I mean.
speak;Lucy;My mother was the healer for the royal army,|but since she's sick I'm trying to fill in for her until she recovers.
speak;Aqua;Oh, I see! I happen to be a cleric of Vergrande Monastery in Foliaga.
speak;Lucy;That's so cool! So, we're both healers, then.|We should be friends!
speak;Aqua;It would be nice to have another friend, Lucy.
speak;Lucy;By the way, that's a really nice staff.|I don't think I've ever seen anything like it before.
speak;Aqua;Oh, thank you. Sam let us have it on our way back from Oregot.
speak;Aqua;It feels more powerful than the staves I normally use.|It can heal others from a good distance away.
speak;Lucy;That's amazing! Can I give it a try?
speak;Aqua;I don't see why not. Let's go to the infirmary and try it out.
speak;Woman1;Oh, Lucy! Did you need something?
speak;Lucy;Hello, Miss Joan. I just wanted to try out this new staff.|Is there anyone who needs help right now?
speak;Woman1;Why, Brennan here happened to come in with a sprained wrist earlier.|I'm sure he'd appreciate the assistance.
speak;Lucy;Um. Wait, let me try again.
speak;Woman1;Lucy, are you sure that staff works?
speak;Lucy;I'm sure it does! I've seen Aqua use it all the time.
speak;Man1;Ah, I feel so much better. Thank you!
speak;Woman1;Thank you very much for your help, you two.
speak;Lucy;Looks like we've got a mystery on our hands, Aqua.|Let's figure out what's with that staff!

name: SupportChellSam
_source: speak;Chell;Sam, do you have a moment?
speak;Chell;You've been in Oregot this whole time?
speak;Chell;How did you happen to get the cabin you have?

speak;Sam;Shortly after I left, I was recruited by a mercenary company.|They helped me, gave me training.|We cleared out that cabin when it was being used as a bandit hangout.|Eventually, I left them and went solo.|I went back to that old cabin, cleaned it up a bit,|and just used it as a base of operations, so to speak.
speak;Chell;Oh. It's rather large for someone all alone.
speak;Sam;Yeah, a little. But there's still too many bandits.|Once Oregot is safer, I'll probably settle down with someone, but not yet.
speak;Chell;You mean you don't have a girlfriend? Perhaps a pretty girl mercenary?
speak;Sam;No, been too busy killing bandits,|tracking down the one who killed your parents, and all that.
speak;Sam;Still tracking him down. He's in Oregot, I know that much.|I got some of his captains, but not him yet.
speak;Sam;By the way, how's Lin doing?|She'd be part of the pegasus knight unit by now, right?
speak;Chell;She went on her own a few years back.
speak;Chell;I haven't heard from her since the goodbye note she left.|She said she was going to be a mercenary.
speak;Chell;I only hope she's still alive and well.
speak;Sam;But anyway, I'm going to go train want to come?
speak;Chell;I would love to. It's been too long.

name: SupportChellAlexB
_source: speak;Chell;Mother{tgm}...{tgm} Father{tgm}...{tgm} Am I doing things right?
speak;Chell;It's been three years and Lin is still gone. I don't know if she's safe or not.
speak;Chell;Oh, it's you, Alex. You surprised me.
speak;Chell;Lin went off to Medea knows where,|Sam has been gone for eight whole years,|I lost my parents{tgm}...
speak;Chell;If they hadn't died, if he had been around, maybe Lin would have stayed.
speak;Alex;You can't dwell on "maybe"s and "what if"s, Chell.
speak;Alex;Not when there is still the present moment to keep your focus on.|Here, I brought some flowers for your parents' tombstones.
speak;Chell;I know this is asking for a lot, but could you stay with me for a little while?|I don't want to be alone right now.

name: SupportForrestTaylor
_source: speak;Taylor;General Forrest, I admire the work ethic,|but does it look like I wanna talk about our last session?
speak;Forrest;It looks like you're ready to drink yourself into a stupor.
speak;Taylor;Glad we're on the same page.
speak;Forrest;Ah, hold on. Perhaps I should join you.
speak;Taylor;I'm a big boy, General, no need to worry!|But you can still tag along if you want. The more, the merrier!
speak;Taylor;By the way, have you actually drank alcohol before?
speak;Taylor;Not a problem! We'll start you off easy to figure out your tolerance.
speak;Taylor;I don't want you going out of commission tomorrow morning.
speak;Taylor;Explaining to Her Highness why her most trusted knight is having|the worst hangover of his life is something I DON'T want to do.
speak;Forrest;I trust that you know what you're doing, Taylor.
speak;Taylor;Of course I know what I'm doing!|Now, come on, let's head to the tavern! Drinks on me!
speak;Taylor;General Forrest! Hey! You doing okay? You're looking more sour than usual.
speak;Forrest;Taylor, what happened on the night we went to the tavern?
speak;Taylor;Oh. Uh. Why{tgm}...{tgm} do you ask{tgm}...?
speak;Forrest;The women in town were giving me strange looks the last time I went out for errands.
speak;Forrest;I can only assume something{tgm}... unsavory happened.
speak;Forrest;I can hardly recall anything from that night, though. It's all a blur.
speak;Taylor;It's probably best to let it stay a blur, buddy.
speak;Taylor;For your own peace of mind, I mean.
speak;Forrest;Taylor, I fear my reputation is on the line here.|I need to know what happened.
speak;Taylor;Don't say I didn't warn you.
speak;Taylor;It wasn't as bad as it sounds! Really!
speak;Taylor;I mean, you were definitely enjoying yourself.
speak;Taylor;And those ladies really liked it when you--
speak;Forrest;Stop stop stop no no no I don't want to hear anymore.
speak;Taylor;Would me saying I was jealous make the situation any better?
speak;Forrest;*sigh* This is all too much{tgm}...
speak;Taylor;Whoa, got another bouquet, General? That's the third one this week!
speak;Forrest;Taylor, that tavern outing was a horrible idea.
speak;Forrest;The women in town won't leave me be.
speak;Forrest;First, it was the barmaid, then the general store's shopkeeper, then the baker{tgm}...
speak;Forrest;And then it just kept going! I can't take it anymore, Taylor!
speak;Taylor;You're way too stressed about this.
speak;Taylor;Just look at how popular you're getting! You're gonna get a wife in no time.

if;get_support_rank('Krista', 'Forrest') == 'S' or get_support_rank('Kai', 'Forrest') == 'S' or get_support_rank('Chell', 'Forrest') == 'S' or get_support_rank('Alex', 'Forrest') == 'S' or get_support_rank('Marina', 'Forrest') == 'S' or get_support_rank('Reem', 'Forrest') == 'S' or get_support_rank('Torgen', 'Forrest') == 'S'
speak;Forrest;First off, I already have a partner.
speak;Forrest;First off, I'm not ready for marriage.

if;get_support_rank('Krista', 'Forrest') == 'S' or get_support_rank('Kai', 'Forrest') == 'S' or get_support_rank('Chell', 'Forrest') == 'S' or get_support_rank('Alex', 'Forrest') == 'S' or get_support_rank('Marina', 'Forrest') == 'S' or get_support_rank('Reem', 'Forrest') == 'S' or get_support_rank('Torgen', 'Forrest') == 'S'
speak;Forrest;Secondly, even if I didn't, this is not how I would want to meet them.
speak;Forrest;Secondly, even if I were, this is not how I want to meet my future partner.
speak;Forrest;Especially when they only find me attractive if I'm intoxicated.
speak;Taylor;Oh, I'm sure it ain't like that! You've got a lot going for you as is.
speak;Taylor;You're handsome, loyal, and strong. Anyone would want a husband like that.
speak;Taylor;And being a flirty drunk is just the cherry on top.
speak;Taylor;But seriously though, this is really good for you!
speak;Forrest;How in Medea's name is this good?
speak;Taylor;Lemme put it into perspective for you.|You're so dedicated to training and serving the royal family.
speak;Taylor;But that also means you don't set aside time for yourself outside the castle.
speak;Taylor;You gotta let yourself live beyond your duties, General.|It's good for the soul!
speak;Taylor;Let me ask you this. Wasn't that night at the tavern fun?
speak;Forrest;From what little I remember, it was.
speak;Taylor;Exactly! Expanding your world and experiencing new things does wonders!|And that can all start by meeting new people.
speak;Taylor;I'm not saying you gotta drink 'til you pass out every night to do that.|It can be something small like striking up a conversation with the shopkeeper|next time you do errands.
speak;Taylor;Or flirting back the next time you get a gift from one of the girls in town.
speak;Forrest;I could try your first suggestion, though.
speak;Taylor;That's what I like to hear!
speak;Taylor;Anyway, you've obviously had a long day. You know what you need?
speak;Forrest;If you're going to suggest alcohol, I swear to Medea--
speak;Taylor;You got it! To the tavern we go!
speak;Taylor;Finally warmed up to the occasional tavern outing, huh, General?
speak;Forrest;I'd say that it's more I'm enjoying my time with you, Taylor. With drinks or not.
speak;Taylor;Ha! I'm glad to hear that. I'm really enjoying your company too.|It helps that you've loosened up a bit once we got this ball rolling.
speak;Taylor;How about we celebrate with another round?
speak;Forrest;An excuse for more drinks? I suppose I don't mind. Go ahead, Taylor.
speak;Taylor;Hey, barkeep! Another round for me and my buddy here!
speak;Taylor;Well, I like you too. You're a great comrade.
speak;Forrest;Nah, nah, it's more than that. It's wayyyy more. *hic!*
speak;Taylor;Uh, General? I think you've had too many--
speak;Forrest;I really really *hic!* like ya, Taylor.
speak;Taylor;G-General, I'm flattered. Really, I am.|But, you sure you wanna do this in public?
speak;Taylor;Yeahhhh{tgm}...{tgm} You know what, let's just go ba--
speak;Taylor;Not in front of the ladies, come on!
speak;Taylor;... Oh dear Medea, this better not awaken something in me.;;;thought_bubble

name: SupportChellJoshua
_source: speak;Joshua;Man, Chell, you're not as frail as other Pegasus riders I've seen.|You've got a good bit of bulk on ya!
speak;Chell;Oh, um, thank you, Joshua.|But, what's with this all of a sudden?
speak;Joshua;I was wondering if we could do a quick spar.|I wanna see just how strong you really are!
speak;Joshua;Wow, nimble AND strong. Not bad at all, Chell.
speak;Chell;I'm surprised at how easily you can swing that sword around.|Why, it looks more like a slab of metal than an actual blade.
speak;Joshua;Old Iron is heavy, sure, but these muscles aren't just for show, you know.
speak;Chell;At any rate, how did you come to wield{tgm}...{tgm} "Old Iron", was it?
speak;Joshua;Took a lot of strength training to actually lift up this bad boy.|It was my father's sword at first, actually.|He said he'd only hand it down to me if I could lift it.
speak;Joshua;You can see how that went.
speak;Chell;Oh my. Your father must have also been quite a strong man.
speak;Joshua;Old Iron looked so natural in his hands. He could swing it with ease.|Even more than I ever could.
speak;Joshua;You alright, Chell? You look flushed.
speak;Chell;Ah, yes, I'm fine, thank you.|Although, could I watch you the next time you train?|Seeing you use Old Iron is{tgm}...{tgm} enlightening.
speak;Joshua;Sure! I don't mind at all.

name: SupportSamAnil
_source: speak;Sam;Anil, where are you?!|Krista needs you for something!
speak;Anil;Whose bright idea was it to recruit the Prowling Tiger into this army?;;;thought_bubble
speak;Anil;Oh, Oreg, he's even bigger than the rumors say...;;;thought_bubble
speak;Sam;Look, you know what I mean!
speak;Sam;What do you mean "nope"?!|Look, I just wanna know why you've been avoiding me.
speak;Anil;[There is no way I'm going to get along with the Prowling Tiger.]
speak;Anil;[The Prowling Tiger!]|[The infamous mercenary who's been killing bandits up and down southern Oregot.]
speak;Sam;Alright, hold it, hold it, hold it!|I have SO many questions.|First off, people have heard about me?|They have a NICKNAME for me??
speak;Anil;[What did you expect?]|[You've taken out thousands of bandit camps the last five years at least!]
speak;Sam;Hundreds? Maybe. But THOUSANDS?|Someone out there's exaggerating things.|And what was that about being a mercenary?|Sure, there was some mercenaries who taught me stuff, but that was it.
speak;Anil;[So you at least admit to killing a mass number of bandits?]
speak;Sam;Yeah, but it's not like I wanted to be famous for it.|I had my own reasons for doing what I had to do.
speak;Sam;Bandits kidnapped Krista years ago.|I couldn't let that happen ever again.
speak;Sam;Not just her either.|Everyone I love will not get hurt by bandits again.
speak;Anil;[Just be thankful you didn't make your way up north.]|[Because if you pulled the same thing there,]|[you'd have bandits out for vengeance against you too.]
speak;Anil;[And one of those bandits could've been me.]
speak;Sam;{tgm}...{tgm} So, he used to be a bandit, huh?

name: SupportSamAlex
_source: speak;Alex;Oh, hello Sam. I didn't know you liked the library too.
speak;Sam;Hello, Alex.|Yes, I usually come here after training to unwind or|sometimes prior to settling down for the night.

speak;Sam;A legend about the warrior Kull, the Crimson Lion.|He became bewitched and killed his entire village, family, everyone, and|has to go across the lands performing deeds of atonement.|In the end, he dies, saving the life of a single shepherd.
speak;Alex;Did he manage to atone for his wrongs? He wasn't in his right mind.|He was under a spell, it sounds like, so it wasn't his fault.
speak;Sam;I like to think he did, but the legend seems to imply that he did not.
speak;Sam;It ends with the words "Beware the folly of Kull or suffer his same fate".
speak;Alex;I've been reading this one story,|"The Silver-Tongued Knight and the Silken-Haired Lady".
speak;Alex;About love, promises made, some kept others broken.
speak;Alex;The Silken-Haired Lady gets stolen from her home and|the Silver-Tongued Knight goes on a daring chase in pursuit of her captors.
speak;Alex;In the end, he rescues her, and the two share a kiss.
speak;Sam;I see, interesting.|What other books do you like to read, Alex?
speak;Sam;That's a lot of different books you've read, Alex. I might give some of them a try.
speak;Alex;If you ever do, please let me know what you think of them.
speak;Alex;While you can't judge a book by its cover,|you most certainly can tell a lot about a man by his bookshelf.
speak;Alex;"Myths of the Journey", "The Adventures of Robin Took", "The Blade in the Boulder"{tgm}...
speak;Alex;Quite the selection. Sam is surprisingly a man of culture.
speak;Alex;I wish Taylor had a varied taste like this.|All he has are combat manuals, books on weapon and armor upkeep{tgm}...
speak;Alex;And all those cocktail recipe books{tgm}...
speak;Sam;Huh, she sure has a lot of romance books.|Doesn't she read anything else?|Where's the legends of dashing knights and bold heroes?
speak;Sam;Oh, here we go!|"Sir Lionheart and the Mouse".
speak;Sam;Come on! Not another romance book!
speak;Sam;Hmm{tgm}...{tgm} A lot of books on tea and herbs.|Wow, did not know she was a tea connoisseur.|Oh? What's this? "The Bride of Florin"?
speak;Sam;This better not be another romance book.
speak;Alex;Sam, what are you doing in my room?
speak;Alex;Looks like you found something interesting.
speak;Alex;Oh, "The Bride of Florin"!|That's one of my favorites. It's really good.
speak;Sam;I like the duel between the Dread Pirate Roberto and Azul. That was good.

speak;Alex;I like when all Weyland says to Lily is "As you wish".|It's sweet and endearing when they kiss at the end.|That copy has a beautiful illustration at the end of|them holding hands and looking towards the sunset.|I always like seeing it.
speak;Sam;Say, is that a new book for your collection?|Oh! "The Blade in the Boulder"!|That was my favorite book as a kid. It's a good read.
speak;Alex;How did I walk out of Sam's room with this book?;;;thought_bubble
speak;Alex;I was browsing your library, and this caught my eye.
speak;Alex;I left, forgetting I had it in my hand.
speak;Sam;Feel free to borrow it. Mind if I borrow this book?
speak;Alex;Go ahead. Thank you, Sam.|Anyway, I need to go. I have a scheduled training session in a few minutes.|Until next time.
speak;Sam;Quiet girl, but sweet. She's fun to talk to about books.
speak;Sam;But, man, she needs to branch out a little.

speak;Alex;Interesting man, but it's nice having another bookworm around to talk to.|I wish he had more books on romantic heroes and fair maidens, though.|Closest thing he had was about Sigurd and Brunhild.

name: SupportKristaForrest
_source: speak;Forrest;*sigh* No, not even a bit.|Of course.
speak;Forrest;Yes. Then, it's time for lessons.
speak;Krista;Maaaan. Do I gotta?|They're so boringgggg.
speak;Forrest;Yes, you "gotta".|As future queen of Medeas, you must be knowledgeable in many aspects.|Not just combat, but also history, mathematics--
speak;Krista;"And literature and theology to ensure a well-balanced mind, body, and spirit|befitting a proper ruler of Medeas."
speak;Krista;Man, I've lost count of how many times I've heard that spiel.
speak;Forrest;I wonder why that might be.
speak;Krista;Anyway, I'm too hungry to argue about it.|Let's head off to the dining hall.
speak;Forrest;What was she mumbling about just now?|Could it be that nightmare?;;;thought_bubble
speak;Forrest;Your Highness, it is time for--|Ah. Still asleep, as per usual.
speak;Krista;Gah! I'm up! I'm up!|Oh, Forrest. It's just you.
speak;Forrest;You were having that nightmare again.
speak;Forrest;Your Highness, you shouldn't blame yourself for--
speak;Krista;I don't wanna talk about it, okay?!
speak;Krista;S-Sorry, I didn't mean to snap at you. I just...
speak;Forrest;It's fine.|But please understand, if you ever do wish to talk about it,|I am always willing to lend an ear.
speak;Krista;Mm-hm{tgm}...{tgm} Was that you singing just now?

speak;Forrest;I, erm, well{tgm}...{tgm} It's just{tgm}...{tgm} It pained me to see you in so much distress night after night.|So, I thought maybe singing a lullaby could help. If it was a bother, then--
speak;Krista;You have a nice voice, Forrest. It helped.
speak;Krista;Oh, hey, would you look at that. I actually woke up on time for today's history lesson.|Let's head to the library--
speak;Forrest;We can postpone the lesson until later today.|Or even make up for it on a different day.
speak;Forrest;You should get your rest, Your Highness.|I'll even sing you to sleep, if you'd like.
speak;Forrest;Yes. It has been a long time since you have been well-rested.|I won't let you waste that.
speak;Krista;Lemme just get settled back in here.
speak;Forrest;♫ La la la la~ Hm hm hm la la~ ♫
speak;Forrest;{tgm}...{tgm} Your Highness? Are you still awake?
speak;Forrest;{tgm}...{tgm} I hope you dream of me.
speak;Krista;When this is all over, I'm probably not gonna be the princess of Medeas anymore.
speak;Forrest;As regrettable as it is, you are most likely correct.
speak;Krista;Since we're on the same page about that, I wanna ask you something.
speak;Krista;Knowing I can't go back home{tgm}...{tgm} Would you still want to stay by my side?
speak;Krista;Wh-Whoa, that was a sudden answer!|This is serious, Forrest. You gotta put some thought into it--
speak;Krista;No way. I refuse to believe that!
speak;Krista;You wouldn't throw away everything just to be with me.
speak;Krista;You have a life in Medeas, Forrest!
speak;Krista;What are you talking about? You're a knight!|A knight under direct service to the royal family at that.|Even if I'm gone, you still have a duty to uphold--
speak;Forrest;I was merely born into this position, Your Highness.|It was expected of me to uphold my duties to protect the royal family.
speak;Forrest;But as time passed, I realized what my own desires were.
speak;Krista;What are you trying to say?
speak;Forrest;My loyalties do not lay with Medeas, let alone the royal family.|They're solely with you, Krista.{br}Only you.
speak;Forrest;I've never been more honest about anything in my life.
speak;Krista;All I ever did was pile my problems onto you!|If you accepted that because you were my knight, I'd understand.
speak;Krista;But if what you're saying is true, then why?
speak;Forrest;Even if I wasn't born into knighthood, I'd still remain by your side.|You're everything to me.
speak;Forrest;I don't want you to suffer alone.
speak;Forrest;I will be there to protect you no matter the cost!
speak;Krista;I don't know what to say{tgm}...
speak;Forrest;There's no need for further words, Krista. Just{tgm}...
speak;Forrest;Please forgive me for my boldness.
speak;Forrest;I apologize. I've wanted to do that for so{br}long{tgm}...
speak;Krista;Heh, never thought I'd see you be so{br}forward.|Here. Let's do that more properly.

name: SupportKristaKai
_source: speak;Kai;Excellent work, Your Highness.|Your swordsmanship has been improving steadily.
speak;Krista;Thanks! You're pretty good yourself, as usual.
speak;Kai;I believe we deserve a break after such a good spar.
speak;Kai;Say, I've been curious about something.
speak;Kai;Your sword skills are decent, but what about other weapons?|I heard that Medeans of the royal bloodline are trained to use weapons of all kinds.

speak;Krista;Yeah, that's true, but{tgm}...{tgm}|When Chell's parent's were still around, they taught me the sword and lance.|Then Forrest took over after they passed away.|And back when Sam was around, he tried to teach me stuff about axes.
speak;Krista;And don't even get me started on magic.|That went absolutely nowhere.
speak;Krista;Even though none of those things stuck with me,|I was pretty decent with a bow back in the day.|Though, it's been a while since I've used one.
speak;Kai;The bow? Who taught you archery?
speak;Kai;Ah, the late prince of Fuegsol, was it?
speak;Krista;Um, anyway! I gotta, uh, help Forrest with a thing!|Talk to you later!
speak;Kai;Hm{tgm}...{tgm} So those rumors I heard{tgm}...{tgm}|Was there some truth to them after all?
speak;Kai;So that's how arranged marriages work in the Medean royal family{tgm}...{tgm} Fascinating.
speak;Krista;Got your nose in a book as per usual, Kai?
speak;Kai;Ah, Your Highness. I'm surprised to see you here.|What brings you to the castle library?
speak;Krista;Forrest says I gotta brush up on my history knowledge.|He caught me in a "no study" mood, so I'm not gonna bother.
speak;Krista;The least I can do is PRETEND to study.
speak;Krista;But enough about what I'm supposed to be doing but not actually doing.|What are you up to?
speak;Kai;Just doing research on something that caught my attention.
speak;Krista;Hey, wait a sec. That's a book on the Medean royal family!|You should've come to me if you wanted some info.|Get it straight from the source!
speak;Kai;The source who devotes no time to studying her own continent's history?
speak;Krista;Still, I can probably help with your research! Even if it's something small.
speak;Kai;Hmm... Well, since you're offering, I'm curious about the arranged marriages within the|royal family.
speak;Krista;You got it! Lucky for you, I actually know a lot about this.
speak;Krista;I'm sure Yondo's other royal families got the whole arranged marriage thing too,|but Medeas has a whole system on how to choose the heir's partner.
speak;Krista;You probably noticed when looking down the family tree,|but there's a cyclical pattern going on with the betrothed's home nation.
speak;Kai;Yes, I did notice that. I assume this has to do with Medeas' public relations?
speak;Krista;My ancestors figured out this system so that one nation wouldn't|be favored over the other when it came time for a political marriage.
speak;Kai;Interesting... So, according to this, your father married a priestess from Foliaga.
speak;Krista;Yup! With Foliaga being the previous nation in the cycle,|that means Fuegsol would have been next in line.
speak;Krista;S-Sorry, uh. Anything else you needed, Kai?
speak;Kai;One last thing, if you don't mind.
speak;Kai;Dumb question, but how much did Prince Ervan mean to you?
speak;Krista;He was everything to me, Kai. I loved him more than anything.|And I know that he felt the same.
speak;Krista;I miss him so, so much.
speak;Kai;Thanks for your time, Princess. You've been a great help.
speak;Krista;I should get going now. Talk to you later.
speak;Kai;So, Ervan and Krista were close. That much was true.|But accusing her of murdering him?|Merely the common folk spreading outlandish rumors yet again.
speak;Kai;Disproving that does get a load off my mind, though.
speak;Kai;C'mon, Princess! You almost got me that time!
speak;Kai;There we go. Let's call it here.
speak;Krista;You've been making these lessons tougher lately, Kai.
speak;Krista;Have you been holding out on me or what?
speak;Kai;I'll let you figure that out.
speak;Krista;No straight answers from you, as always.
speak;Kai;Of course I do.|Just bumped into you, Forrest, and Felicity one day while|you were shopping in the castle town's marketplace.
speak;Krista;If you told me that months ago, I would've believed you.
speak;Kai;What if I said that was actually the truth?
speak;Krista;I'd say you're full of shit.
speak;Krista;So, what's the deal, then?|Considering all that snooping you've been doing since you got here,|you're obviously trying to get info on something.
speak;Kai;But if you knew I was trying to find something,|why didn't you do anything about it?
speak;Krista;Call it a hunch, but I feel like something would've happened by now if|you had bad intentions behind all that research you were doing.
speak;Kai;A bit too trusting, are we?
speak;Krista;You still haven't done anything yet, though.
speak;Krista;We've known each other for almost a year now, Kai.|You've got an ample amount of info to blackmail me with now, don't you?
speak;Krista;If you really wanted to, you could do just that.|Makes me wonder just what you're after.
speak;Kai;Well, well. Guess I've underestimated you, Princess.
speak;Kai;You know what? I'm feeling nice. I'll give you a hint.
speak;Kai;No catch. You just gotta use that head of yours to figure it out, is all.
speak;Krista;Alright, lay it on me, then.
speak;Kai;With Ervan gone for so long, are you ready to move on?|Or is there something else on your mind?
speak;Kai;There you go. That's your hint. We'll talk later, Princess.
speak;Krista;Damn it, getting all close and personal{tgm}...
speak;Krista;He did that on purpose to throw me off, I know it!
speak;Krista;But bringing up Ervan like that, though{tgm}...{tgm} I wonder{tgm}...
speak;Kai;So, Your Highness, what's your plan from here?
speak;Krista;Dunno. After this is all over, I'm probably gonna get arrested for murdering Ervan.|Thrown in the dungeons or worse. No hero's welcome for me.
speak;Kai;At least you're not completely ignorant of the punishment you'll receive.
speak;Krista;How could I have been?|It's something that's always been in the back of my mind.

speak;Krista;This is gonna sound silly, but I kept thinking "What if I never get caught?"|No one other than Forrest knew, so I thought I could still have my chance to become queen.|To be the leader my people needed.
speak;Krista;To make up for everything{tgm}...{tgm} for Ervan's sake{tgm}...
speak;Krista;I know. I was being dumb.
speak;Kai;Hey, I never said that.|I'm just baffled at how stupid I've been this whole time.|You've proved me wrong yet again, Princess.
speak;Kai;I thought this love you showed to everyone had been all an act.|But it was genuine, wasn't it?
speak;Kai;This army, your people, Ervan...|You've loved everyone and kept loving everyone despite everything.
speak;Kai;Foolish? Maybe.|But I can't deny that it's what got us this far.
speak;Krista;It's what a proper ruler should do.|That's what I believe, at least.
speak;Kai;If only things were different, huh?
speak;Kai;Hey, I've got a proposition for you.
speak;Kai;Run away with me, Krista. Neither of us has a place in Yondo anymore.|Once this is all over, let's get outta here.|We can start a whole new life together. Just the two of us.
speak;Krista;Kai, come on.|You were finally being completely honest with me, and now you pull this?|I thought you were better than that.
speak;Kai;I want to be with you. I've fallen for you.
speak;Kai;How could I not have? After all this? After all we've been through?
speak;Krista;I{tgm}...{tgm} Wow.|I'm sorry. This is just so sudden.
speak;Krista;Now would be a REALLY good time to pull the "just kidding".
speak;Krista;H-Hold on! I wasn't mentally prepared for this.
speak;Kai;Is it really so hard to belie--
speak;Krista;Can I confess something to you, Kai?
speak;Krista;When Circ's Talons captured me, they put me under an illusion spell.
speak;Krista;They brought me back to a part of my past.|Before everything went wrong.

speak;Krista;The fact you were there snapped me out of it.|I was brought back to the happiest moment in my life, and yet{tgm}...{tgm}|I couldn't imagine a world where I didn't meet you.|You're too important to me, y'know?
speak;Kai;You flatter me too much, Princess.
speak;Kai;My offer of running away together is still on the table, by the way.
speak;Kai;The way things are, sounds like a pretty good idea, right?
speak;Krista;That does sound nice, but I wanna tie up some loose ends if I can.
speak;Kai;Don't even worry about it. I figured you'd say something like that anyway.
speak;Kai;I'm leaving Yondo as soon as this is all over, so{tgm}...
speak;Kai;Find me, okay? I'll be waiting for you.

name: SupportMichaelCeleste
_source: speak;Celeste;Heyyy, Michael, there's a store nearby.
speak;Michael;You don't have something bad planned do you?
speak;Celeste;No, it's a very nice store and I want to get us both something.
speak;Michael;Last time we went to one, we had to clean up the entire thing.
speak;Celeste;No, it's a gem store.|There's these gem pairs that mean "Best Friends Forever".|I want to take you with me and see if we can get them.
speak;Michael;O-Oh, well, thank you. I guess I'll go with you.|Is it an outdoor store?
speak;Celeste;Yeah, aren't gem stores like that usually?|Are you worried about seeing a lot of people?|We can go to the smaller stores first if you aren't comfortable.
# Original script by Blade of Light 12 #
speak;Celeste;Is your armor too heavy for you?|You've never been particularly strong, and I'd be upset if something were to happen to you.
speak;MichaelArmorless;I'm{tgm}...{tgm} not having any trouble with it.
speak;Celeste;I'm taller than you, older than you, and still physically stronger than you.
speak;Michael;P-Please put me down. The armor is fine.
speak;Celeste;Is that so? I'll have to carry you with it on to see if it is.|If I can, then that means you'll be fine.
speak;Celeste;Alright, I get it. Let me put you down.
speak;Celeste;But if it really is, could I wear it?
speak;Celeste;I hope he's really fine in all that armor.|I wouldn't want him to strain himself.
# Original script by Blade of Light 12
speak;Celeste;*sigh* What am I going to do?
speak;Celeste;I need to find my mother when this is all over, but how will I know if she'll be okay?
speak;Celeste;The beach is pretty nice, isn't it? Check out this pearl I found!
speak;Michael;There's something wrong, isn't there? Please don't hide it.
speak;Michael;I came here a while ago to get resources.|I heard you talking to yourself about your mother. It's weird seeing you so upset.
speak;Celeste;You don't have to worry about me. I'm fine.
speak;Celeste;Speaking of her, remember she said you'd be good at using lances?|Turns out she was right.
speak;Michael;My mother, on the other hand, was against it.
speak;Michael;She was always teaching me that I must be polite whenever I can.
speak;Michael;Needless to say, she thought using weapons wasn't "polite".
speak;Michael;Still, that didn't stop her from letting us go to each other's houses.|Even if you were a little{tgm}...{tgm} energetic.
speak;Celeste;I remember you were often there for my axe training.|I even let you try giving it a couple of swings.
speak;Michael;With that, I guess what I'm trying to say is that if there is anything bothering you,|you can tell me.|We're friends, after all.
speak;Celeste;Hey, Michael, why don't we do some stone skipping?
speak;Celeste;No use in dwelling on something we can't control.
speak;Celeste;So, come on! Let's have some fun!
# Original script by Blade of Light 12 #
speak;Celeste;Oh, hey again, Michael. Looking for more resources again?
speak;Celeste;I was just looking for my axe.
speak;Celeste;How do I lose something like that?
speak;Michael;It's not the craziest thing you lost.
speak;Celeste;Hey! It's not like I lost you! That would be sad.
speak;Michael;Ha, true. But I'll help. I'd love to, in fact.
speak;Michael;Hey, does this place look familiar to you?
speak;Celeste;You too?|Like the time we first met when I saved you from bullies?
speak;Michael;They told me to go in, otherwise they'd said they do something to my mom.
speak;Celeste;It was a good thing I showed up when I did, then.
speak;Celeste;I came in, beat them senseless, and they ran away.

speak;Celeste;You were crying, so we just started talking to calm you down.|I remember telling you about how the forest wasn't that scary,|and a bunch of other stuff.|And then we both said that our favorite color-
speak;Michael;If you didn't do that I'd be just an errand boy for them,|and I wouldn't have thought of joining the knights.
speak;Michael;I've got to thank you for that.
speak;Celeste;You already have.|After that, I took you back to my house.|My mom wasn't sure how she felt about me going to the forest by myself.|But she was glad I rescued someone.
speak;Michael;Well, can't really say I'd blame her. We were pretty dirty.|You also begged her to let me stay the next two days.
speak;Celeste;Ah{tgm}...{tgm} I wish I could find her soon.
speak;Michael;Hey, when this is all over, we'll go find your mom and|ask her if{tgm}...{tgm} if we could start dating.
speak;Michael;Then you can actually reading the books I gave you.
speak;Celeste;What do you mean?! I do read them.
speak;Michael;Oh boy, if my mother were still around...;;;thought_bubble
# Original script by Blade of Light 12 #

name: SupportKristaTrevor
_source: speak;Krista;Trevor! Just the man I wanted to see.
speak;Trevor;Is there something I could assist you with, Your Highness?
speak;Krista;Yup! I got a huge favor to ask.|It's something that's been on my mind for literal years.
speak;Krista;Could you teach me how to do magic?
speak;Trevor;I{tgm}...{tgm} suppose? It is not that simple, however.|Do you have any innate magical potential to begin with?
speak;Krista;See, that's the thing. My mother was a priestess from Foliaga.|So you'd think that would mean I could do magic myself.
speak;Trevor;I am assuming that is not the case?
speak;Krista;I can handle enchanted swords just fine, but that's as far as I can go.
speak;Krista;I wanna test a theory. I'm thinking maybe I'm just a late bloomer.|And here's where you come in with this little experiment.
speak;Trevor;I will guide you through the basics of magic and see if something happens?
speak;Trevor;I don't see why not. This could prove to be an enlightening experience.
speak;Krista;Great! Just lemme know when you're free then we can get this rolling.
speak;Trevor;I believe so. I was thinking we should start with a simple fire spell.|Fire is the easiest element to control as well as the easiest to monitor.
speak;Krista;Got it! So, just gotta read from a tome and do the thing?

speak;Trevor;Oh, if only it were that simple. Remember what I said about innate magic ability?|That applies here. A tome does nothing if there is no energy to work with.|Think of tomes as amplifiers of one's inner magic.

speak;Krista;Ah, nothing.|It's just that you reminded me of something an old friend of mine told me a long time ago.|She said something similar to that when explaining magic to me,|if not that exact thing word for word.
speak;Trevor;Oh{tgm}...?{tgm} Who was this friend of yours?

speak;Krista;House Valoria's daughter.|She was the one who was supposed to teach me magic in the first place.|Y'know, if magic was actually passed down to me.|It's their duty to teach the Medean royal family's heir magic stuff.
speak;Krista;I hope she's doing well. It's been so long since I last saw her.
speak;Trevor;I{tgm}...{tgm} I'm sure she is, Your Highness.
speak;Krista;You doing okay, Trevor? You got quiet all of a sudden.
speak;Trevor;Worry not. I am quite alright, Your Highness.|Although, I would like to ask something about House Valoria's heir.|If you do not mind, of course.
speak;Trevor;At the time when she did try tutoring you in magic, what was she like?|What did you think of her?
speak;Krista;What, got a crush on her or something?
speak;Trevor;Your Highness, please! I feel nothing of the sort!
speak;Krista;Haha! Sorry, just wanted to tease ya.
speak;Krista;But really, I liked her a lot. She was my best friend.|I didn't really have a lot of friends my age growing up.
speak;Krista;Besides Prince Ervan and his brother, I mean.
speak;Krista;When everyone noticed that magic wasn't a thing for me,|House Valoria stopped sending their daughter to the castle.
speak;Krista;When mother and father told me she wouldn't be coming anymore, I couldn't stop crying.
speak;Krista;It's okay. I got over it eventually.
speak;Trevor;Do you still think of her?
speak;Krista;Yeah, I do.|Sometimes I wonder how much things would be different if magic came naturally to me.
speak;Krista;She'd probably be at my side along with Forrest and everyone else.
speak;Trevor;Ah, no. At any rate, shall we continue with the lesson?
speak;Trevor;Yes. Here is how we shall do this{tgm}...
speak;Trevor;Perhaps we should try something else?|Like you said, you may just need some time. Let us try again tomorrow--
speak;Krista;Trevor, it's okay. I think we should stop here.
speak;Krista;I probably wasn't born with magical abilities, so I don't think this is gonna go anywhere.|Thanks for trying this with me, though, Trevor.
speak;Krista;H-Hey, no need to look so down! It's not a big deal--
speak;Trevor;I apologize. I have failed you years ago, and I have failed you now.
speak;Krista;Huh? What are you talking about?
speak;Trevor;All my life, I could not meet anyone's expectations.|My family turned its back on me. My duty as the Valoria scion was unfulfilled.|Then fate chose to bring me back to you.
speak;Krista;Whoa, whoa, whoa! Slow down there!|Trevor, you can't be suggesting{tgm}...{tgm} Th-There's no way...
speak;Krista;All this time{tgm}...{tgm} YOU were House Valoria's daughter?!

speak;Trevor;I stripped myself of that identity the moment I left home six months ago.|I thought I was done with the past. And yet, it has come back to haunt me.|For a moment, I had the hope things would turn out differently.|That I could redeem myself of at least one failure.
speak;Trevor;I was wrong. So, so wrong.

speak;Trevor;I am a fool to think anything in my life would turn out right for me!|Does Medea just want me to suffer?|To torment me with reminders of my shortcomings?|This cursed past of mine... why can I not leave it all behind{tgm}...?
speak;Trevor;It is all so agonizing! Oh, Medea, what have I done to deserve this?!
speak;Krista;Are you even hearing yourself? Saying all those things{tgm}...{tgm}|That's not the Trevor I know!

speak;Krista;Trevor, listen to me. You didn't fail me in the slightest.|Like I said before, I missed you and kept thinking about you.|And here you are! You're back!|It's all I could have ever wanted.|The only thing I wish was that I knew it was you sooner.
speak;Trevor;Krista{tgm}...{tgm} I{tgm}...{tgm} I am so sorry{tgm}...

speak;Krista;You don't have to apologize for anything.|It isn't your fault things didn't turn out the way people expected.|It's nobody's fault. Sometimes life is unfair like that.|Despite all that, you chose to shape your own future.
speak;Krista;And I think that's amazing, Trevor. You're not a failure.|You never were.
speak;Trevor;Even after all this time, you choose to be kind to me.|I do not deserve this. And yet...
speak;Trevor;I thank you. If you believe in me, perhaps I can start believing in myself too.
speak;Trevor;Your Highness--I mean, Krista.|I{tgm}...{tgm} I mean{tgm}...{tgm} Erm{tgm}...

speak;Krista;You don't gotta be formal around me if you don't want to, Trev.|Now that I know who you are, I think it would be nice if we could talk to each other|like we did when we were kids, y'know?
speak;Trevor;Ah, yes. Of course. You have a point.
speak;Krista;So go ahead and loosen up already!|You look like you're gonna collapse at any moment.
speak;Trevor;Sorry, I just{tgm}...{tgm} Krista, there's something I need to say.|Something super important!

speak;Trevor;Krista, I gotta be honest with you.|I{tgm}...{tgm} I've loved you for as long as I can remember.|When my family introduced me to you, I fell in love at first sight.|You were just so pretty and when I actually got to know you,|I couldn't help but fall for you more.
speak;Krista;H-Huh? Trevor, this is really sudden!|What brought this on?

speak;Trevor;I did a lot of thinking, and I knew I had to tell you at some point.|I knew I couldn't back then. Nothing would've ever happened between us.|You were to be engaged to a Fuegan noble. That's how things were supposed to go.|And even then, I was a girl. You had to produce an heir down the line.
speak;Trevor;Even now, I think that what I'm about to do is stupid.
speak;Trevor;But I have to try! If I don't, I'll never live it down.
speak;Trevor;Krista, I{tgm}...{tgm} I can't see myself as a failure any longer.|This is the final thing I have failed to do: tell you how I truly felt about you.
speak;Trevor;Accepting me, rejecting me{tgm}...{tgm} It doesn't matter to me anymore!
speak;Trevor;Even being by your side merely as your retainer will be enough, if it comes to that.
speak;Krista;That is no way to do a proper marriage proposal.|Don't set yourself up for a rejection like that!
speak;Krista;Keep your head high and propose to me like you really mean it, lover boy!

speak;Trevor;Krista, I've loved you for the longest time.|I've forged my own path in this life,|and I'd be overjoyed if you chose to walk this path alongside me.|So then{tgm}...{tgm} will you marry me, Krista?
speak;Krista;Now THAT'S what I call a proposal.

name: SupportKristaJoshua
_source: speak;Joshua;Krista! I got a proposition for ya!
speak;Joshua;Y'see, I've been observing your sword techniques,|and I think I can help you get even better at handling swords.
speak;Krista;Oh? What did you have in mind?
speak;Joshua;So, your defenses and speed are good. Nothing wrong there.|What you DO need more of is raw strength.
speak;Krista;And a big, strong, buff man like you is gonna get me all big, strong, and buff?
speak;Joshua;You get it! How about we get the ball rolling now?
speak;Krista;I'm down! So, what sort of training do I gotta do?
speak;Joshua;No, no, no. We can't train 'til we get more muscle on ya.
speak;Joshua;And to do that, we gotta get some food in you to fuel them!
speak;Joshua;To the dining hall, Krista! Let's go, let's go!!
speak;Krista;Wait! I just had lunch!!|I can't eat anymore! WAIT!!!
speak;Joshua;So, how do you feel? Feel the burn?
speak;Joshua;Great! That just means you're making progress.
speak;Krista;Joshua, I won't doubt your methods, but I feel like I'm literally gonna explode.|Or collapse.
speak;Joshua;No problem. We can take a break and pick things up tomorrow--
speak;Krista;Could you hold that thought?|Collapsing and exploding incoming.
speak;Joshua;Yeesh, that ain't good.|Uh, let's pick things up in a few days instead?
speak;Invisible;Sure. As long as you can carry me to my room.|Please?

name: SupportKristaRembrandt
_source: speak;Rembrandt;You may come over, Your Highness.|I just finished.
speak;Krista;Sorry about that.|I didn't realize you were performing the Fading Smoke ritual.
speak;Krista;Who were you paying respects to, if you don't mind me asking?
speak;Rembrandt;If you would like, you may pay your respects to Prince Ervan as well.
speak;Krista;I'm not sure if I{tgm}...{tgm} I mean, I just{tgm}...
speak;Rembrandt;{tgm}...{tgm} Do you know the significance of this particular ritual, Your Highness?

speak;Rembrandt;Each aspect of the Fading Smoke ritual represents an individual's life and death.|The bonfire itself is one's life, burning with warmth.|And the smoke that rises reflects how fleeting life is.|It rises into the air and dissipates as if it were never there.

speak;Rembrandt;Though, there are signs that it had existed. Like the scent of wood smoke, for instance.|The bonfire itself also remains until it burns out.|Much like those who left us, there are still traces of them left behind.
speak;Rembrandt;Even so, everything has to end eventually.|Like the bonfire, it must die out.|Eventually, you must let go.
speak;Rembrandt;I will not tell you how to mourn over Prince Ervan's death, Your Highness.|However, you must remember you cannot hang onto him forever.

name: SupportKristaSemi
_source: speak;Krista;Hey, Semi! How're you doing today?
speak;Krista;So, uh, wanna hang out or something?
speak;Krista;We could sit around in the courtyard.|Or maybe have some quiet time in the library?
speak;Krista;Or! We could eat at the dining hall!|I heard the cooks got some really good mutton today!
speak;Semi;Can't you go bother someone else?!
speak;Krista;And the boy speaks! It's a miracle!
speak;Krista;My offers still stand, by the way.
speak;Semi;I'll use small words so you can understand.
speak;Krista;Technically, that was only one small word.
speak;Semi;Why the hell do you want to spend time with me so badly?
speak;Krista;Well, since we're working together and all,|I figured we could try to be friends?
speak;Krista;Since--let's be real--you've been hostile to me ever since we met.
speak;Krista;Look, I just wanna know why.|I haven't done anything to you.
speak;Semi;It doesn't matter if you did anything or not.|Just leave me alone.
speak;Semi;How many times have I told you to leave me alone?
speak;Krista;I can probably count how many on both hands.
speak;Semi;The correct answer is too many.
speak;Krista;Semi, my friend-not-friend, we have reached a standstill.
speak;Semi;Look, if I tell you why I don't like you, will you leave me alone?
speak;Krista;Can't guarantee it, but I might if the reason sounds valid.
speak;Semi;Alright. Don't expect me to pull any punches here.
speak;Krista;Not like you ever did with me in the first place.|Go for it. I can take it.
speak;Semi;Don't say I didn't warn you.
speak;Semi;I lived with my mother for most of my life here in Medeas.|We lived out in the countryside.|She was a weaver and sold the tapestries she made to keep us fed.
speak;Semi;He left us before I was even born. My mother never talked about him beyond that.
speak;Semi;My mother{tgm}...{tgm} She was all I had.

speak;Semi;You heard me.|Thrown in the dungeons just because one of her tapestries depicted Medea wrong.|I know his body looked a little off,|but that shouldn't be something someone should be arrested for!
speak;Semi;Your family took my mother away from me for such a stupid reason!|I can never forgive any of you for this.
speak;Semi;She was all I had and now she's gone.
speak;Semi;And that's it. Everything I loved was stripped from me.|And it's all your family's fault.
speak;Krista;I'd better check out the dungeons.
speak;Krista;About your mother{tgm}...{tgm}|I talked things over with the dungeon guards.
speak;Krista;Long story short, your mother's a free woman.

speak;Krista;Yup. They let her go.|I told them what you told me, and they let her go free.|Unfortunately and unsurprisingly, your mother was in bad shape,|so I'm having our clerics look after her 'til she gets better.|Once she's back on her feet, we're sending her back home.
speak;Krista;Yeah, of course!|She shouldn't have been arrested in the first place.
speak;Semi;Why bother going through all that trouble, though?|You did this for a complete stranger.|A complete stranger who allegedly was a criminal, no less.
speak;Krista;It was the right thing to do.|And I can understand what you went through.|It's hard losing someone you love too soon.
speak;Krista;I know the feeling too well.
speak;Krista;Unlike me, you have an opportunity to see her again.|I wouldn't want to take that away from you.
speak;Krista;I know this won't make up for the years she was gone,|but now you'll have something to go back to once this is all over.
speak;Krista;Anyway, that's all I wanted to talk to you about.|See ya later.
speak;Krista;No big deal. That's what friends are for.

name: SupportTaylorAlex
_source: speak;Alex;Ah, there you are, Taylor.|Training again, I see.
speak;Alex;Yes, actually.|I have something I wish to discuss with you.
speak;Alex;It seems all you do is train.|Don't you have anything else you do during your free time?
speak;Taylor;Uh, I go to the tavern?
speak;Alex;I am well aware of that.
speak;Taylor;Speaking of which, wanna grab a drink after I'm done with training for the day?|My treat!
speak;Alex;No. I do not want a repeat of last time.
speak;Taylor;Oh, come on!|I'll limit myself to three mugs of ale this time!
speak;Alex;You may be physically strong, but you need to be mentally strong too.|That's why I'll lend you this.
speak;Alex;Yes. Luckily for you, I picked something I think you'll enjoy: "The Trials of Sir Aaron".
speak;Alex;The battle scenes are quite exhilarating, and the main character is a noble, brave warrior.|Much like you, in a way.
speak;Taylor;Heh. Flattery will get you nowhere, Alex.
speak;Taylor;Still, I'll give this whole "reading" thing a go.|You obviously put a lot of thought into this.|I'd hate to disappoint my best friend.
speak;Alex;Thank you, Taylor.|Let me know what you think of it when you're done.
speak;Taylor;Hey, Alex, about that book you lent me{tgm}...
speak;Alex;Oh, you finished it?|What did you think?
speak;Taylor;I'm gonna be blunt here: Terrible.
speak;Alex;Really? Why do you say that?
speak;Taylor;You know that part when Aaron was going one-on-one against that general?|That was the worst display of swordsmanship I've ever seen!
speak;Alex;I thought it was a heart-racing moment.|His sword pierced right through his armor, and he took him down in one blow!
speak;Taylor;Yeah, but piercing through PLATE? That stuff's thick!|There's no way Aaron's blade could've done that.|And stuff like that keeps happening over and over through the entire book!
speak;Alex;There's this thing called "suspension of disbelief", you know.
speak;Taylor;Well, my disbelief is far from suspended.
speak;Taylor;Anyway, here.|You can have your book back.
speak;Alex;*sigh* I suppose I will have to re-think my approach{tgm}...
speak;Taylor;I don't get what the big deal is.|Why would I read about fighting when I do it all the time?
speak;Taylor;Hm?|Looks like she forgot one of her books.
speak;Taylor;Let's see{tgm}...{tgm} "Tryst by Moonlight".|Wonder what this is about?
speak;Alex;Taylor, I seem to have misplaced one of my books.|It's called "Tryst by Moonlight". Have you seen it?
speak;Taylor;Oh yeah! You dropped it the other day.|Here you go.
speak;Alex;What a relief! I thought I would never find it again.|Thank you, Taylor. This is one of my favorites.
speak;Taylor;I can see why. It's pretty good!
speak;Alex;Is that so? What did you think of it?
speak;Taylor;The relationship between Percy and Lana is sweet, if a little tragic.|All that hardship, just for Percy to die at the end{tgm}...
speak;Taylor;Poor Lana. Gotta admit, I teared up.
speak;Alex;Huh. Well, I'm glad you enjoyed it.|I would have never thought you'd be a romantic, Taylor.
speak;Taylor;Me neither!|So, you got more stuff like that?
speak;Alex;I do. Would you like something bittersweet again or something more lighthearted?
speak;Taylor;Something lighthearted this time.|I don't feel like crying over a book again. Maybe some other time.
speak;Alex;Haha! I'll see what I have, then.
speak;Taylor;Oh, Alex. Here's "Passing Ships in the Night" back.
speak;Alex;Ah, thank you, Taylor.|Did you like it?
speak;Taylor;Yeah, not bad. Thanks for all the book recommendations, by the way.|I've been liking all of them!
speak;Taylor;Speaking of which,|I stopped by the marketplace and got you something.
speak;Alex;A book for me? Hm{tgm}...{tgm}|It has no title.
speak;Taylor;I know. You gotta open it up.
speak;Alex;Wait, it's a fake book?|W-With a ring inside?|Taylor, are you{tgm}...?

speak;Taylor;"I bestow upon thee this ring unto thine finger."|"Like the blade clasped in my right hand and the shield in my left,"|"may this ring be a symbol of my undying oath to protect and serve you, my beloved."
speak;Alex;You memorized Percy's proposal to Lana?|Just for me?
speak;Taylor;Yeah. That's not too lame, is it?
speak;Alex;No, not at all. It's{tgm}...{tgm} really sweet, actually.
speak;Taylor;So, what do you say, Alex?|Will you marry me?
speak;Alex;Yes, of course, Taylor!|I wouldn't have it any other way.

name: SupportTaylorNagisa
_source: speak;Taylor;Hey! You're Lady Tsubaki's retainer. Nagisa, right?
speak;Taylor;Taylor, co-captain of the Medean royal army. Glad to meet ya!
speak;Taylor;Yeesh, Her Highness was right. You're a prickly one.
speak;Nagisa;Can you leave me alone? I'm busy training.
speak;Taylor;I can see that! And that brings me to why I'm here.
speak;Taylor;With you being one of the newbies, I think it's a good idea to get to know each other.|Since we're working together and all.
speak;Taylor;Aw, don't be like that. It'll be fun!
speak;Taylor;The way I see it, there's two good ways to get to know a person.
speak;Taylor;One: see them fight. Two: see 'em at the tavern.|And I've seen you fight plenty already.
speak;Taylor;Oh, no, no, no. I gotta see both sides of the coin!
speak;Taylor;Two different situations, two different sides. Get it?
speak;Nagisa;I'm not going to the tavern with you.
speak;Taylor;Trust me. This'll be the perfect bonding experience.
speak;Taylor;Besides, you're just about done training, aren't you?|You'll want a refreshing drink after working so hard.
speak;Nagisa;I suppose I'm not against it.
speak;Taylor;There we go! We can get going as soon as you're ready.
speak;Nagisa;An' I just don' *hic!* understand, Taylor!|Why'd they jus' *hic!* up an' leave like that, huhhhh?
speak;Taylor;That's{tgm}...{tgm} a real rough story, Nagisa.
speak;Taylor;Yeesh, how drunk is she? She barely had a sip and she's already like this.;;;thought_bubble
speak;Nagisa;An' now I gotta take care of Tsu-Tsu all by m'self{tgm}...
speak;Nagisa;Yeah! *hic* Who else would it be?
speak;Taylor;Yeah, that sounds like a lot{tgm}...
speak;Taylor;Speaking of a lot, you definitely had more than your fill of drinks.|Let's head back.
speak;Taylor;Actually, that's probably not a bad idea.
speak;Taylor;Alright, up and at 'em. Time to go, Nagisa.
speak;Taylor;Yo! Nagisa! Hard at work again, huh?
speak;Nagisa;I was thinking about our time at the tavern.|I remember some of what happened, but could you fill in some blanks?
speak;Nagisa;First off, did I mention anything about Lady Nagisa?
speak;Nagisa;Not. A word. About that. To ANYONE. Understand?
speak;Taylor;You also had me carry you--
speak;Taylor;Hey, you're the one who asked for it!
speak;Taylor;Don't worry, I was all gentlemanly about it.
speak;Taylor;You also said stuff about Kai and{tgm}...{tgm} Kenji, I think? I dunno.
speak;Taylor;Honestly, you were slurring your words a lot, so it was hard to understand most of it.
speak;Nagisa;Forget everything I said about those two.
speak;Taylor;Now, hold on there. I did get some of what you said.|It sounded like you really missed having those two around back in Edoyama, right?
speak;Taylor;At least Kai's here! Maybe you can talk things out--
speak;Nagisa;As if I'd talk to a womanizing traitor like him!
speak;Taylor;Huh. Wonder what she meant by that.

name: SupportTaylorMichael
_source: speak;Taylor;Why don't you show me what you can do? Come at me!
speak;Taylor;For your age, you're not bad.|You have good control over your lance.
speak;Taylor;Your attacks are a little slow though.
speak;Taylor;I'm not criticizing you, kid. Just making observations.
speak;Taylor;On the flip side, your defenses are excellent.|For most people, it would be hard to get any meaningful attacks on you.
speak;Taylor;What is it, kid?|And don't call me "sir" all the time. Just Taylor is fine.
speak;Michael;{tgm}...{tgm} Taylor.|Why did you become a knight?
speak;Taylor;Because I get to ride a fu--
speak;Taylor;I dash around the battlefield and look damn sexy while doing it.
speak;Taylor;Also, I can get myself a couple shots of whiskey every night.|Speaking of which, let's go relax at the tavern!
speak;Michael;Going to the tavern doesn't seem very knightly.
speak;Michael;I guess if Sir Taylor does it, it's okay.
speak;Michael;Still, I don't know about this.
speak;Taylor;Come on, put your backs into it! Let's go, let's go!
speak;Taylor;Now, who's up for a round of drinks!?
speak;Taylor;You guys go on ahead. I'll catch up in a bit.
speak;Michael;You lead your men amazingly, Sir T--
speak;Michael;It's just that with how you are in the training yard compared to how you are at the tavern{tgm}...
speak;Michael;It's like seeing night and day.
speak;Taylor;What do you expect? I can't have a stick up my a--
speak;Taylor;And I can't be a lolly-gagger all the time either.|You gotta strike a balance with these things, Michael.
speak;Taylor;Wait, what do you mean by "surprisingly"?
speak;Michael;Anyway, thanks again for letting me observe, Taylor.
speak;Taylor;No problem.|Now, come on, Michael! The tavern awaits!
speak;Taylor;Of course you are! Let's go!
speak;Taylor;Here's to another great training session, boys!|Bottoms up!
speak;Michael;I don't think I'll ever get used to this{tgm}...
speak;Taylor;Michael, my friend, I think it's about time we get you the strong stuff.
speak;Taylor;This is your first step to manhood!|Finish up that mug of water then we'll get you a pint of the good stuff.
speak;Michael;I-I don't think that's a good idea--
speak;Taylor;Hey, get some ale in my friend's mug here!
speak;Taylor;You've been workin' so damn hard all this time, Mikey!|It's time you let loose!
speak;Michael;How did you get this drunk that fast?
speak;Woman3;One mug-full of ale coming up!
speak;Michael;Maybe just a sip wouldn't hurt.
speak;Michael;As long as I keep track of how much I'm drinking, I should be fine.
speak;Taylor;♫ Fill up my tankard with a pint of fresh ale~ ♫
speak;Michael;♫ An' 'til th' mornin' comes, never mind what entails~ ♫
speak;Taylor;♫ For when that hard whisky be sloshin' in mine cup~ ♫
speak;Michael;♫ Both th' beer and the bitters will raise my soul up~! ♫
speak;SoldierYellow1;Andddd they're down.|Let's take 'em home, Greg.
speak;SoldierYellow2;No need to tell me twice.

name: SupportKristaAqua
_source: speak;Krista;Oh, great Medea, may your golden scales carry the weight of these sins--
speak;Aqua;I'm sorry, did I interrupt your prayer?|If so, I deeply apologize.
speak;Krista;No worries. I was just{tgm}...{tgm} doing a daily prayer.|Nothing incredibly sacred or anything.
speak;Aqua;Nonsense! Any communication with your god should be treated with respect.|Please, finish your prayer in peace. We can talk later.
speak;Krista;Alright. Thanks, Aqua.|But really, you don't have anything to apologize for.
speak;Aqua;I still feel bad about it.
speak;Aqua;Oh, I have an idea! Why don't we pray together from now on?|That way, I won't walk in on you praying again.
speak;Krista;Well, I guess that's fine if you're alright with it.
speak;Aqua;Perfect! The next time you wish to pray, please let me know.
speak;Aqua;Are you ready to begin, Your Highness?
speak;Krista;I guess so. How do you suppose we go about this?|Being from Foliaga, you worship Folia, right?
speak;Aqua;Yes, that's right.|While I'm used to praying aloud with others when I was with the clergy,|I will be alright with us silently praying.
speak;Krista;I mean, uh, sure.{br}Fine by me.
speak;Krista;What kind of god is Folia like? Just curious.

speak;Aqua;He's a benevolent god, providing bountiful harvests and the beauties of nature|to everyone in Foliaga.|He treats his followers with love and care, and never turns his back on them,|no matter the circumstance.
speak;Aqua;And what about Medea? What is he like?
speak;Krista;Hardy, all-knowing, and protective of Yondo as a whole.

speak;Krista;He strives for peace amongst his children and provides guidance to his followers.|My family--the royal bloodline--are descendants of him, you know.|We're expected to follow in his footsteps.|Be not only a good leader to those in Medeas, but to all of Yondo as well.
speak;Krista;Considering everything, I wonder if I{tgm}...
speak;Krista;S-Sorry, Aqua, I started to ramble a bit there, huh?
speak;Aqua;No need to apologize, Your Highness. It was interesting to learn about Medea, especially|when you have such a close connection to him.
speak;Aqua;And if you don't mind me saying, I think you live up to be as good of a leader as Medea|expects you to be.
speak;Aqua;I'm glad we can do this together, Your Highness.|Despite us worshipping different gods, I found this to be a pleasant experience.
speak;Krista;Honestly, I agree.|This wasn't as bad as I thought it would be.
